Reviews.Title: “Memorable stay!”
Reviews.Author: Joe P
Reviews.Content: I recently returned to the Mercure Kensington on a trip to London with my aunt (receiving her MBE at Buckingham Palace!) and was pleasantly surprised at how refreshed the hotel looked. Stayed in an executive room which was worth paying a bit extra – free soft drinks in the mini bar and robes. Bed was comfy and staff were very obliging, keeping our luggage while we went to the palace for the day. Lift was a bit slow but nothing drastic. Breakfast has really improved – fresh grilled tomatoes! Was really worth returning to. Will be back.

Reviews.Title: “Mecure London Kensington”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: For the price the stay was acceptable - though had I not been an A:Club card member I would have probably stayed elsewhere. It is OK for location, convenience to London South-West and amenities. I stayed for 3 nights with my wife and young baby. The room size, which was a priviliedge King Size, was too small for the big bed and the baby's travel cot (literally no room to walk around the bed), which was dissappointing and inconvenient. Had I travelled alone then my review would have been more positive as on the whole it was good value for money. I would recommend to others if they want to be near Earls Court ... though not if they have children. Otherwise, I am sure there are better/bigger hotels for the same price.

Reviews.Title: “There is no such thing as free lunch”
Reviews.Author: raulds
Reviews.Content: The expression above translate exactly what I feel about this hotel. There is a reason it is way cheaper than other Mercure hotels in London. It not feels like a Mercure at all. Would be more honestly if they re-brand it as Ibis. But this not means it is a bad hotel. In fact it is quite good with comfy beds, nice shower with plenty of hot water, nice TV with premium channels and outstanding location. The room I had stayed was quite big with a king size bed, good sized bathroom and bathtub. It was recently refurbished so the room itself felt like brand new but the bathroom have a tired look with some stains from the age but nothing that would bother me. In the room you will find the usual: safe, ironing facilities, kettle, coffee and tea. In the bathroom toiletries as soap, shampoo, shower gel, etc. Polite staff but not really proactive. But it is not a problem for me. Location is superb. Close to Earls Court tube you can reach anywhere in London easily. Also if you are coming from Heatrow this tube station is part of Piccadilly Line. So you can travel from the airport terminals 1,2,3 and 5 to the hotel without change lines, what is very convenient. Also not far you have the Gloucester Rd Tube and High Kensington St Tube besides several buses. Speaking in High Kensington St, it is 10 min walk distance from hotel. Also It is a few stations away from Westfield London. So if your thing is shopping this is a good hotel to stay. Yet related with location, nearby you will find a Sainsbury (one block away) and a Waitrose (more less 10 min walk) where you can buy groceries, sandwiches, etc. Also inside Sainsbury there is a Starbucks but I recommend the coffee from the Coffee Republic in the hotel lobby. it's way better than Starbucks and the price is right. Nearby the hotel you also will find several restaurants of Thay, Indian, Italian and several other cousines and some pubs. I recommend the King's Head for pub. Nice atmosphere, nice prices and no attitude. The brand Mercure may misleaded my expectations but it is in fact a good value for money in London. A huge downside is the charge of 20 pounds for 24 hours internet access. If you need internet don't buy it and maybe these chains stop to charge for something that should be part of the deal. Just go to a mobile phone store and buy a pay as you go SIM card. With 10 pounds I got a T-Mobile SIM with all the internet I needed in my mobile with possibility to use it in other devices. I would recommend this hotel to friends.

Reviews.Title: “Not up to Mercure usual standard”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Having been patronized Mercure/Accorhotel for yrs, never had such bad experience. No heat at first night, telephone not worked at last night, only fix next morninig. What's more - water dripping sound (after toilet flush) lasted long & annoying. But front desk staff friendly & efficient.

Reviews.Title: “Last minute room - very good value for money in London”
Reviews.Author: suffolkdale
Reviews.Content: Had to arrange an overnight between meetings and booked this room via the Mercure website - paid Â£66.Got a small (but prefectly formed!) room with a double bed and all the trimmings from bath robe to all toiletries to tea/coffee and biscuits. Helpful pleasant staff and quick route to Earls Court tube which gives you easy access into central London. Given I paid less than half Hiltons were charging and less than Travelodges were charging (with nothing offered), it was very good value and I would recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Dreadfully pokey room”
Reviews.Author: wakemeformeals
Reviews.Content: I travel to Japan frequently, so I am no stranger to compact hotel rooms - but the Mercure Kensington still gets the prize for the least space to move in a room! The room was called a "double" - and indeed the bed was a double - but there was no space around the bed. One had to climb over it to get to the desk at the other side. I had to store my suitcase against the door. It was not an enormous suitcase - but that was the only place to put it. That frankly presents a safety risk - you have to block the door with your luggage when you are in the room. The window was drafty and loose - but the weather was mild so that was not a problem. However on a windy winter night I am sure it would bang and rattle. The location of the hotel is convenient, but overall the room was below the standard one expects from Accor hotels. (I do 30-60 Accor nights each year, so generally I think it's a good brand).

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Texp
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 2 nights on 30/31st Jan 2012. Quite a decent rate but no breakfast. About 10 mins from Gloucester Road tube but quite good for visits to History museum and Victoria and Albert and Royal Albert Hall (about half and hours walk), plenty of restaurants nearby. The staff were very friendly and the room was quite good, 6th floor, no noise, obviously dont know what the other floors are like, couldnt quite get the heating on properly as it was really cold outside but not too bad as to be freezing inside, so overall not too bad. Thought the hotel was ideal for what we wanted.

Reviews.Title: “London January 2012”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Internet charges of Â£15.00 per day were outrageous. Room decor, lovely to look at, but impractical to live in. Very little space to hang out clothes--same under previous ownership. But no draws in which to place clothes. What happened to the dresser and desk? Breakfast--same old bread supplier. Maybe one of your staff should go to Starbucks in Sainsbury to buy bread and pastries. And the orange juice looks awful, and does not taste like much of anything. BREAKFAST ROOM STAFF VERY HELPFUL.

Reviews.Title: “Well-placed and comfortable”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Five minutes' walk from Gloucester Road tube, close to nearby supermarkets, restaurants and small selection of other shops. Large and comfortable room (Executive double) with an all-important bath as well as shower, the latter powerful and with plenty of hot water. Downside as with all Accor hotels is the need to pay for internet access, but otherwise it is good value for money (though no breakfast). Bed very comfortable, and heating/air con easy to control. Small desk/chair area - a comfy chair would have been a bonus. The windows didn't open, which I would have preferred, but the double-glazing was very effective, for a room that overlooked the main road. I'd certainly stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable rooms, helpful staff.”
Reviews.Author: Katongo
Reviews.Content: Before my stay here, I was expecting the worse because some of the reviews are pretty bad. I now think that some of the reviews are just simply unfair. I found the staff to be helpful and professional. The room was on the small side, but comfortable and it was easy to adjust the temperature to make it comfortable for sleeping. Both the bedroom and bathroom were very clean and decorated well, with modern facilities. Breakfast was adequate, not amazing. I would like to have seen some fresh fruit. Tinned peaches and tinned grapefruit pieces made me feel like I had time travelled back to the 1970s. Location wise, the hotel is a short walk from Earl's Court and Gloucester Road tube stations. There are lots are restaurants near both stations. You could also easily walk to Kensington High Street. I would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Acceptable for a short stay. Good prices. Clean & convenient.”
Reviews.Author: Ballencrieff
Reviews.Content: Have stayed here several times for short 1-2 night trips to London. Always booked the "small" room as I am always a solo traveller. The room and bathroom was definitely small, but I didn't really mind that too much. The worst part was the fact there are a very limited number of TV channels. The price is very good if you book an advanced rate. Less than Â£80 a night near Gloucester Road tube station is a great deal. There is a large supermarket nearby as well as several half-decent restaurants. There are also a couple of mid-size supermarkets and restaurants near the tube station. The Natural History Museum is very close, so is the Science Museum, Victoria and Albert Museum, Royal Albert Hall and the Ismaili Centre isn't far either. There are lots of eateries near the South Kensington tube station too, which is about 10 minutes walk away. There is a Marriott and a Holiday Inn almost directly opposite this hotel but they charge some crazy prices for their rooms. (They also tend to hide their taxes when you book, which is very annoying. Mercure doesn't do that.) I never tried the breakfast as I think you can get a better deal away from the hotel. London has so many restaurants and cafÃ©s so you might as well explore them.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome location, clean and confortable”
Reviews.Author: domingos_soares
Reviews.Content: I've stayed there for 15 days with my family before the names change so I can't vouch for it now but the following is an accurate description of the experience we had there. We got a double-bed (king size) double-room. The rooms are clean and very confortable and kind of small but that's the norm in London so don't expect to find anything much larger somewhere else. The breakfast was terrific (in such a way that I realized I like english breakfast :-) ). The staff was always very polite but they could be more friendly (it would no hurt to smile more) - with the exception of housekeeping (they were always very friendly and polite). The restaurant had almost no options for dinner so we had to go somewhere else at night even if we were very tired. The location is awesome - very close to two tube stations and the Earls Court Road with its many restaurants. The price is not cheap but London is not a cheap place either.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel is fine...think it got a bit of an unfair rap previously...”
Reviews.Author: NikkiRedhead
Reviews.Content: My partner and I stayed here on 23rd Dec as it was one of the closest and cheapest branded hotels to where we wanted to be. The stay was absolutely fine. All staff were very helpful, nothing was a problem. The rooms were clean, a slight bit on the small side but this was definitely not a problem for us. Our only issue was the hot water did take a while to get going mid morning but again the staff were very helpful and helped sort this within ten minutes. For central London the price was very fair and I think reflected the hotel. I would recommend a stay here and would book again.

Reviews.Title: “New Year was Amazing”
Reviews.Author: LOUISE H
Reviews.Content: my partner and i were lookinbf for some where to stay for the new year fireworks, Other hotels were ripping us off and then we were recommended this hotel which was perfect. the price even though peak season was reasonable and staff were so friendly. the location is great to get around and the coffee shop a real life safer in the cold weather. rooms were comforatble and we enjoyed the new year without breakng the bank ! woudl defo stay here again

Reviews.Title: “services”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: there was no hot water for 20 mins in the morning for 22nd morning,also people chating loudly from neibours could not sleep well the last night. the other services was ok, the lacation and the value of the hotel is good.

Reviews.Title: “Xmas shopping and saved money”
Reviews.Author: Ajayk1803
Reviews.Content: Booked hotel last minute for London Xmas theatre break and some shopping. Room was ok but we saved on hotel and spent on shopping. Breakfast was good and hotel was busy which was nice buzzy atmosphere. Would stay again for quick weekend in London .

Reviews.Title: “Quality Crown/Mercure”
Reviews.Author: Roy H
Reviews.Content: My wife & I had booked a box at the Albert Hall for a Christmas concert & wanted a hotel near the Hall. We booked for 1 night on line through an agency at a very good price. We received confirmation on line in the name of Quality Crown. As the hotel was very near a tube station & we had just 1 small case we took a train & walked to the address. I had looked at the hotel,address etc. on line so knew where it was, however we could not find it & it was fortunate that a passing traffic warden helped us by explaining that the hotel was now the Mercure. We checked in and very helpful desk staff apologised for the confusion. We had booked a small room which was very clean, comfortable &well equipped. I asked the desk staff how to get to the Albert Hall they were very helpful & explained &also gave us a map.We had a very quiet , comfortable night. The inclusive breakfast was very good both in quality& quantity with pleasant helpful staff.We did not use the lounge etc.but it looked very pleasant & comfortable. All in all we enjoyed a very pleasant stay.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Stay and perfect location”
Reviews.Author: Jon K
Reviews.Content: Just stayed at this hotel which we read some different views. However the location is great and easy access to all the easy transport in London. The rooms are not like the ritz (not that we've stayed there) but they are clean and very comforable. the staff are friendly and the lady in the coffee lounge area in receptions just does not stop smiling! . We needed somewhere to stay for a family weekend in London to do some Xmas shopong and this hotel and staff were excellent. Even the taxi's outside were friendly saying the hotel is always busy !

Reviews.Title: “Mercure London Kensington”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Having stayed at the Mercure London Kensington - the hotel is all newly refurbished so that was all good. New beds and bedding, bathrooms etc. Free toiletaries in bathroom and chocolates on your pillow! The rooms however are extremely small. Don't think about walking around the bed, you have to practically climb over it! If there are 2 of you it will be a squeeze. Bathroom, rediculously small. However, 5 mins to tube station, either Earls Court with all the shops and restaurants or Gloucester Rd and there is a Sainburys just 1 min away that is 24 hour. Would recommend

Reviews.Title: “Never met more rude staff in my life. I checked in after 11pm and was hounded by the security guard. They said my bag was in my ”
Reviews.Author: SarahDees
Reviews.Content: Rude rude rude staff double checking I was staying at the hotel then telling me my bag was in the room. What a lie!! Would have thought in the 4 hours I was out they could have put it in my room. What a rude bunch of people do they want people to return or is their policy be as rude as possible. Cannot believe I have paid to be insulted this much. Front desk staff need a lesson in customer service!

Reviews.Title: “One to Avoid”
Reviews.Author: mabel171
Reviews.Content: When booked it was called the Quality Crown Hotel. It was booked for our anniversary Dec 2nd. This was six months earlier. We had a double room that you couldn't swing a handbag in let alone a cat. The smell of new paint was nauseateing. Then the drilling started on the adjoining wall. We requested a change and were accommodated with the samne size room in the front of the hotel where the traffic noise was unbearable like the room itself. A double room should be advertized as singles. We then requested another move to a bigger quieter room but were told we would have to pay Â£30 a night more. Unacceptable. We then contacted our booking agents Booking.com and within 30 minutes we were moved at no extra cost to a much bigger room, although the walls were like paper and every movement and light switch being put on, tap turned could be heard from neighbouring rooms. Putting up with this so that our entire weekend wasn't ruined we showered for breakfast but there was no hot water. The breakfast which we avoided the following morning was absolutely tasteless, with the cheapest of cheap produce supplied. The staff we dealt with were unhelpful and if it hadn't been for Booking.com the weekend totally ruined. Thank you Booking.com. Mercure no thanks.

Reviews.Title: “Really small room in new hotel”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: The hotel has been nicely refurbished. However the really weak point it that the double bed rooms are really really small. Couldn't event turn around the bed, had to jum over it to acce the desk. Also the bed is a small double bed, have no idea how a couple would fit in it! Sames for the bathroom, really really small!

Reviews.Title: “First Time In London”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Overall, it was an excellent vacation. We were so impressed with the history of your country, museums, shopping, and different restaurants to choose from. Your tube system is amazing - really made it easy for us to get around. Rooms were more than adequate - really just in them to sleep. One suggestion would be maybe not to charge for Wifi or include it in the room fee. We would definitely stay at Mercure again!

Reviews.Title: “Reasonable place, but only if you pay a discounted rate”
Reviews.Author: old_fashioned_chair
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for three nights in a twin room on a "girls trip" to London with my mum. The room was very hot - air con didn't work at all - and as the room overlooked the main road, the windows were sealed shut. The quality of the fixtures and fittings was reasonably good, and the hotel was to a good standard. We slept fairly well, and the road was not too noisy! Check your breakfast tariff, because depending on what you paid for, the breakfast staff will make sure you don't get the wrong thing! We had the Conintental option which comprised reasonable amounts of bread rolls, toast, croissants, jams, basic cereals, dried fruit, basic ham and basic cheese slices. Nothing flashy, but not offensively cheap! If you paid for an English breakfast, you've got the usual options of sausages, bacon, eggs, beans and mushrooms. We didn't bother paying the difference. There's a small coffee shop / bar on the ground floor which is good and isnt too expensive. All in all, it's a slightly further walk from the underground than we'd banked on which was a shame as my mum had a broken ankle. We battled on once or twice to walk there, but it was a bit much for her. Don't do it if you have lots of heavy luggage! If you're not laden down it is an easy enough walk. A reasonably pleasant place, but a little too far out and much too hot for me to return.

Reviews.Title: “Ok for a short stay”
Reviews.Author: iirlane Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: This hotel was touted as a brand new Mercure but it was obvious when I got there that it was an older hotel that had undergone refurbishment. Nothing wrong with that, except it wasn't what I was expecting. The room was small but the bed very comfortable, the staff pleasant.I didn't bother with breakfast as you could get a better one in Earls Court for half the price. LIke all London hotels it's incredibly expensive so try and get an online deal well in advance if you don't want to pay the standard rate. Near Earl's Court and Kensington.. Local restaurants vary a lot in quality: don't go to the trattoria italiana opposite the main entrance - I couldn't finish anything I ordered.

Reviews.Title: “Just about OK”
Reviews.Author: Linds_Zurich
Reviews.Content: I booked this through the Accor group website and was attracted to the fact that it was new. Unfortunately, I had not realised (as another reviewer has since pointed out) that it was simply an old hotel that had been given a lick of paint and rebranded. There was nothing really awful about it, but nothing much to recommend it, either. The one word which springs to mind about the room is "TINY". The bed was very small (OK for one person, but I would not have wanted to share it with my husband), with only a tiny gap at the foot end to get round it. The desk was barely wide enough for the television that stood on it - certainly no room for working. The safe, predictably, wasn't big enough for my laptop, and was also up above my head, which made it difficult to check that I had taken everything out of it. And the loo was jammed so tight against the wall, they had had to put the toilet roll holder up above head height (this felt very strange), otherwise it would not have been possible to lift up the seat or lid. The only saving grace were the staff, who were very friendly, welcoming and eager to please. And the location was good - only a short walk to either Gloucester Road or Earls Court tube stations. But I don't think I'll be going back - there are much nicer hotels at this price level in London.

Reviews.Title: “Mercure....but it does not meet the standards”
Reviews.Author: indodutch
Reviews.Content: Checked in the hotel here on a sunday afternoon 3 days after the opening, well the front was still being put u with Mercure...than at check-in there was a chap i asked him to check me in, but he told me just wait there will be someone coming, finally after 5 min, the same happened at checkout, not the service expected from mercure than when i got in the room, well let us say a shoebox, the tv was on the desk next to the bed, not at the food end, as in most other mercure hotels, so not really convenient to watch tv, also the size of the bed is substantial smaller than the mercure beds all in all a rebranded hotel but not the mercure beds and style in the rooms, just repainted mercure... the prices are good, but actually once you think about it, it does NOT meet the mercure standards

Reviews.Title: “Mecure has to step up”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Could not believe Accor hotels put their name to this hotel. No luggage trolleys, lift is small and looks old. I got to the hotel before checkin and my luggage was stored in the restaurant. What a shock.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel but overpriced.”
Reviews.Author: EmerahlFires
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in a great location, 2 mins walk from the tube and places to eat. The room was beautiful and clean, and the breakfast was lovely. Our room was a decent size, but i was expecting a bigger room for the price we paid.Looking at the hotel plan it seems we were in the biggest on the floor.

Reviews.Title: “Good place to stay”
Reviews.Author: Tommo250
Reviews.Content: Booked this on booking.com for Â£99 for two of us for a saturday night, in this part of London in a chain hotel this was a really good price. The hotel is being re decorated (which we only noticed as we used the stairs and not the lift) and this caused no disruption what so ever. Staff are friendly and helpful, the hotel is clean, the room was on the small side but who cares it was really clean. The breakfast was really good too, we would stay here again. It is ideally placed for the mueseums and Royal Albert Hall.

Reviews.Title: “Nice”
Reviews.Author: Ugne A
Reviews.Content: Hotel was very nice and reception ok. Room was clean,but very very small. Trying to set up an ironing board was a challenge in such a small space.Do not have any complaints,just one small thing. I did not like when barman put ice in to my drink with his hands,It is a bit unhygienic.

Reviews.Title: “More than satisfactory!”
Reviews.Author: Eric T
Reviews.Content: We stayed there for five days, and we booked a discounted small room. And indeed, it is really a small room, I hope that they can show the floor plan of that small room before we booked.....anyway, it is ok for us as we want out for a whole day so size of the room actually does not really matter. We sleept very well at night, surrounding area is quiet. Price including free wifi and breakfast. We stayed in room 201 and the wifi signal was really SUCK! basically you can google but you can't youtube. the signal is good in lobby and at the door by the way. in room 201, it would be better to bring you own light as the light is obviously not enough (you can move the table light on the nightstand to the desk, it will be much more better). Strongly suggest to add some more light in the room as this is not that expensive to add I guess. Breakfast is very good. Staff over there is polite and helpful (so do the front desk). Bathroom is clean and tidy. Overall, this is a very good economy hotel. It is clean and you can get a good night sleep and have a full English breakfast. Location is wonderful!!!! 5min walk to earl's cournt and you can go anywhere you want. Next to the hotel is big supermarket (Saintsbury). So if I need to stay in London I will stay in this hotel for sure.

Reviews.Title: “Couldn't be more helpfull”
Reviews.Author: IadoreEgypt
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a weekend away which we thought we may have to cancel after falling down stairs and hurting my back. Having to cancel some of our excursions, we arrived early at the hotel, not only did they let us check into our room early, on seeing that I was on crutches, they immediately offered to change our room so that we could get a twin on the first floor which made it much easier for getting around. The customer lift was closed for maintenance but they allowed customers to use the service lift so no problems there. The room was perfectly adequate in size and facilities, all staff pleasant and obliging. Will definately stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Quality Crown Hotel Kensington”
Reviews.Author: SharonSCalifornia
Reviews.Content: This is about the 4th time we have stayed at this hotel. We think it offers great value for a London hotel - reasonably priced, clean, an elevator, air conditioned, breakfast included (a buffet that's OK), rooms small but not unreasonable, great location from the tube and to Kensington High Street, museums, etc. We will stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect stay”
Reviews.Author: apoplous
Reviews.Content: Overall a nice place to stay.we stayed during christmas period nice breakfast,clean rooms but a bit tiny,perfect location

Reviews.Title: “good hotel, good value, good location”
Reviews.Author: TLHTooter
Reviews.Content: Good location - about a 5 minute walk from Earl's Court tube stop, 8 minutes to Gloucester Rd station. We stayed there for 2 weeks of BBC Proms concerts - hotel was about a 10-15 minute walk to Royal Albert Hall. The staff was VERY pleasant and helpful. Our King Executive room was more spacious than many rooms we've had in London. Mini-fridge in the room was useful. Sainsbury's supermarket just 2 blocks away. Many reasonably priced Italian and Asian restaurants in the area. The room was well-insulated from street noises, but not particularly sound-proofed from sounds in the hallway and adjacent room. Breakfast was not bad (be sure to request fried eggs, not the awful scrambled eggs on the buffet table). We paid 135 GBP per night, which we thought was pretty reasonable for London, especially considering it included a nice breakfast and free WiFi. We will definitely return next year when we go back to the Proms.

Reviews.Title: “good hotel, would stay again”
Reviews.Author: tjbowers1
Reviews.Content: Just got back from a two day break to London, we were really impressed with this hotel, we had a small double room, admittedly it was cramped but we only needed a bed to sleep, it was all very clean and the bed was comfy, very friendly staff, especially the gentleman who tended the lounge bar, he always remembered our names, impressive! We found this hotel to be a great base to stay so close to Earls Court Tube which meant we could explore London.We would stay again, room rates were very reasonable.

Reviews.Title: “I would be delighted to stay there also during my next London visit.”
Reviews.Author: Hagel004
Reviews.Content: I could share the opinion of some of those who have written here about the location; next to a grocery store and just a few minutes walk from the nearest metro station. The only negative thing I encountered was that the keyboard in front of the television set with which you could surf on the Internet practically didn't work. Sometimes, if you preseed the buttons rather hard, a letter appeared on the screen. I also kind of missed non-English-language satellite channels (e.g. TV5 Monde). The thing I'm most happy about is one of the girls working at the breakfast restaurant. I saw her already as I checked in, we said "Afternoon!" and the first impression already couldn't have been more positive. The English breakfast certainly filled the stomach for many hours to be. The male bartender was a great guy.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location!”
Reviews.Author: wans123
Reviews.Content: Just a 5 min walk away from the tube station and right next to a Sainsbury's supermarket that opens late most nights, Quality Crown Kensington is great value for its location and convenience. Some not so good points about the hotel... room is rather small and can be odd-shaped (at least mine was!). There is only one tiny lift and its Door Open button doesn't quite work. As a fellow guest commented, 'families have been separated here!' Service is pretty okay at the front desk, with helpful managers if you ask. The rooms are cleaned regularly but not too thoroughly. An accidental lipstick stain on a corner of the sheet stayed there for a few days. There were cobwebs around the bedside table lamp. But the biscuits were changed daily and coffee/tea replaced. I also liked the nice mint chocolate placed on the pillows when the beds were turned down. The breakfast room staff is grumpy 80% of the time though efficient and at certain times, nothing is cleared when the crowd overwhelms the small numbers of service people. The toast is always freshly done but they do run out of items and the breakfast items stay the same all the time. I would use the hotel again because it is a reasonable price for the location and the rooms were serviceable with free wireless connection.

Reviews.Title: “Not Good but not bad”
Reviews.Author: varga_nicolas
Reviews.Content: Hotel is quite well located : neighborhood is good, 10 minutes walk from the tube, 5 minutes from the bus. Room is very little ! For the price we paid and compared to the description it's a shame ! The room was dusty. Beds were confortable but 2 separate ! You can here you neighbor from all sides and from the street ! Breakfast is quite good, but expensive. Staff at the restaurant is kind. Staff at the reception is not very kind maybe because we were a young couple. The room was just above the Parking entrance of the delivery trucks ! So, every morning (we stayed 3 nights) we were woken up at 3.00 AM ! They gave me different excuses about that : - I booked a cheap room : false it was a higher class room - I booked my room on a discount site like booking.com : false I payed full price on their website After my complain they admited they always had problems with that room. A received as compensation a single night in the same hotel but as I don't plan to go back in London in the following months the offer will expire.

Reviews.Title: “Superb location - I stay here every time!”
Reviews.Author: JoDevon
Reviews.Content: I discovered this gem of a hotel 3 years ago and have used it for every London trip I've taken since then. The location couldn't be better - minutes from a great variety of indicidual shops, restaurants and cafes and a short walk to some of the best (and free!) attractions, such as the V&A, Science Museum and Natural History Museum. The surrounding area is highly picturesque and safe and it is a joy to stroll up to Kensington High Street and Kensington Gardens and see the postcard-perfect London landmarks of Kensington Palace, Kensington Gardens and the Albert Hall. The Underground is close by and one of the new bicycle hire stations is located in the adjacent street; if going further afield, black cabs are abundant on Cromwell Road right outside the hotel, or Kensington Gore is a 15 minute walk for frequent buses to all London locations a visitor would need. This hotel is in a perfect situation for travellers like me looking to combine a trip to Wimbledon with a jolly in central London; there is so much to do locally that you could spend a week around here without even venturing into the West End! The hotel staff are impeccably polite, helpful and friendly and the rooms are kept extremely clean and with all essentials provided. I stay in a small double room, which is compact (as advertised) but still a comfortable size for travelling couples; noise does travel between adjacent rooms, but the general atmosphere is quiet and in 5 visits I have not been bothered by noisy guests; the facilities in the rooms have been updated since my last visit, with new flat screen televisions and modern electronic room safe. For service, location and price this hotel ticks all the boxes and I have found no reason to look for a different place to stay when I can look forward to another break at this inviting home from home.

Reviews.Title: “Good value, friendly and walkable to the attractions”
Reviews.Author: wendydee
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here for 2 nights, going to Wimbledon tennis. It was easily walked from Gloucester Rd Underground and Kensington High St. (5 - 10 mins) We found it clean and the staff were very helpful in suggesting local eateries. All staff were polite and helpful. Rooms were well-equipped for our needs. It lacked a bit of character but was very functional, clean and well appointed. Air conditioning was efficient and not too noisy and the TV had a full range of freeview stations. Only breakfast was available in the restaurant and a limited number of snacks were served at the coffee shop and bar.

Reviews.Title: “Worn out, tired and not 4 star!”
Reviews.Author: NeikaCopenhagen
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Quality Crown Kensington in May for a romantic getaway with my boyfriend. The hotel did not impress us! The rooms are extremely small for 2 persons, with one suitcase in the room it was more or less impossible to see the floor! The decor was dark and heavy, however the lobby and the small coffeeshop are very cosy. Location is good, 7-8 minutes walk from a tube station and relatively close to the city center. We booked on the webpage of the hotel and had free Internet, movies and breakfast included. Breakfast was not very attractive and very busy. The breakfast restaurant was small and the staff seemed tired and stressed out. Service here was very poor. You have to ask for toast, and there were no fresh fruit avaliable! Furthermore it seemed like the waiters did everything in their own way. Front desk staff was mostly friendly. You have to pay for the full stay upon arrival which I find a bit odd, normally hotels merely take an autorization. Overall the hotel is good for one or two nights if you are not in the hotel during the day. I would not recommend this hotel for businesstravellers or for romantic getaways!

Reviews.Title: “what do they expect the ritz”
Reviews.Author: martinggracey
Reviews.Content: Just back from great stay in london Close to tube stations staff friendly rooms clean and well maintained Breakfast a bit hectic due to small room but staff helplfull and you can eat as much as you like Dont listen to the moaners this hotel is great they expect to get a wake up call from the irish guards playing rule britannia and the queen to phone them personally ITS A HOTEL

Reviews.Title: “Good location - thin walls - ordinary breakfast”
Reviews.Author: WilloandJane
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Quality Crown for 3 nights in March. The hotel was close to the tube and to Kensington, Portobello Road and Hyde Park. We walked to Harrods and the city centre (long way - but great walk). The room was clean, comfortable and well equipped... tea and coffee facilities were appreciated after a long day. While the bed was big and comfortable our sleep was disturbed every night by noisy neighbours at all hours because of the very thin walls... we only used the room for sleep as we were out all day everyday enjoying London, so this noise became an irritation. Breakfast was very average - tinned tomatoes, tinned mushrooms, cold toast and very ordinary bacon and sausages - not the English breakfast we had been looking forward to. A good low-budget option - but bring earplugs and maybe don't take the breakfast option - but try one of the local cafes instead.

Reviews.Title: “Dreadful hotel simply awful”
Reviews.Author: fly-kial
Reviews.Content: I stayed here with my colleague on business. The room was dark and depressing with a door connecting to the next room (locked) I could here the man next door coughing the walls were that thin. They asked for a credit card on checking in for incidentals even though the room was already paid for, I knew I wouldn't be eating/drinking here after seeing the state of the place but they wouldn't check me in otherwise. Anyway a couple of weeks after my stay I received my company credit card bill and they had charged me for a breakfast I never ate or ordered, after calling the hotel they said someone had signed for it from my room, as there was only me in the room I told them this was not possible (my colleague and I had eaten breakfast at a nearby cafe) however after several calls and an email they eventually refunded me although they seemed very accusing rather than apologetic for the inconvenience (now I know why they wanted my credit card details I wonder how many times they get away with this before people notice). This really is a dump of a hotel, dirty, scruffy and with very rude staff.

Reviews.Title: “Just Perfect”
Reviews.Author: dotsattic
Reviews.Content: We are just home from a 4 day stay at this hotel and had a wonderful time. The hotel is just perfect for acccess to the underground and within walking distance of lots of places. The hotel is lovely and clean and the room was perfect, roomy and huge double bed, bath with shower. Lifts to all rooms. We could not fault anything and would highly recommend it. Breakfast was lovely and you can eat as much as you like and if you would prefer something different you just have to ask. The staff were all very helpful and friendly and nothing was too much trouble. You can have fresh towels every day and the noise level from the street was minimal. It was great to have air conditioning in the room as we had a heatwave. Jo in the coffee lounge is really lovely and makes great pizza. There are numerous lovely restaurants around the hotel so you are spoiled for choice as regards eating places. All in all - just perfect!!

Reviews.Title: “Great location but that's it.”
Reviews.Author: LadyGrey107
Reviews.Content: Have stayed at this hotel on several occasions given its great location but would hesitate to go there again. Pleasant welcome at reception (has always been the case) but rooms starting to look shabby. Beds are comfortable but have reservations about cleanliness given stains on carpet. Breakfast was completely chaotic - and the coffee was awful - served by a horde of unsmiling Eastern European women who left tables uncleared but snatched away plates from under your nose. And there were only about 5 TV channels ....

Reviews.Title: “Home away from home”
Reviews.Author: robertpatterson_11
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at this hotel on a couple occassions now and have to stay that it has become my preferred hotel in Kensington. As any other hotel in central London it is a bit pricy but service is second to none. From check in through to check out, every request is dealt with promptly and professionally. Staff had gone extra mile to assist with my requests for deliveries I had to arrange and have been extremely knowledgeable about the area. I have seen the same faces on reception as I was coming back which was nice as much as the fact that they greeted me by my name! The hotel may not be new but it's well maintained and the cleanliness is outstanding. Rooms are not large but it works for me as I travel on business and don't have much luggage, if I would be to bring my wife I would probably book a larger room (stayed in a small double room). Breakfast is good and service is efficient, for people who complain about queues - come for breakfast earlier! In my experience I have not seen a hotel that would have a breakfast room large enough to cater for all it's in-house guests all at the same time. Wifi connection is fast, very important point if you are on business. It's not for free, but I knew it when I booked it. On another note, other advantages include late check out if you ask the staff nicely :) and they also store your luggage for free. Overall, nice hotel with friendly staff and good facilities. Definitely value for money and I will stay again.

Reviews.Title: “I agree, pick another hotel”
Reviews.Author: Enjoy_Travel101_11
Reviews.Content: I use Trip Advisor extensively for research prior to taking vacations and this is the first time that I have felt compelled to write a review. I recently stayed at the Quality Inn in Kensington and although the trip to London was great, the hotel stay was awful. I booked through a major airline vacation package and searched high and low for a room that included free internet, which this one did. I should have taken a screen print of that screen saying free internet because when I got to the hotel the receptionist said this was not true. She told me it was my problem to solve through whoever the airline contracted through. She was rude. So I ended up having to purchase their internet service to contact the airline who responded that indeed I was correct. I took my laptop to her to show her the email and still there was no comment, not a please forward this email to me so I can take care of this and follow up for you. She just said oh. Upon checking out my bill reflected the internet charge had been removed which the airline said they would try and accomplish, if not they would reimburse me upon my return. I asked the desk attended for a copy of my bill so I had evidence I indeed owed zero, he wouldn't give it to me, said it was against policy so now if there is a charge I have nothing to prove charges were supposed to be removed. I have never been to a hotel where upon checkout they wouldn't give me a copy of my bill even if I had prepaid. As for the room, thinnest walls ever. We heard everything from neighbors as though there were no walls at all. Toilet - I realize toilets are different in London but never was I required to lift the lid forcing water to fill up so there was pressure to flush. I complained for 3 days to which they responded they would take care of and adjust, then I just gave up and considered having to manually force the toilet to flush was just another part of this stay. Breakfast - continental breakfast was included in our room rate. They served the exact same thing each day and when we sat down we were reminded by the staff we were only allowed to have cold food. I didn't want their hot food which did not look good, but there is a way of saying where the continental food was located vs 'your room rate only allows cold food'. Two of the male desk receptionist were very nice, but the remainder of the staff was rude at best. I have stayed in London many times and will never stay at this hotel again granted they probably could care less. Location was good.

Reviews.Title: “Not a 4* hotel”
Reviews.Author: cat2Leeds
Reviews.Content: Having been recommended this hotel, we were rather disappointed to find that it did not live up to our expectations. Upon arrival we were met by a very surly "receptionist" who needed to brush up on his customer service skills. We were asked to leave a Â£20 deposit - despite having already paid up front for the room. When we asked what this deposit was for, the reply was "for the room". We explained that we had already paid for the room and he told us that it was to cover any "extras". When we asked what extras - he said that it was for the use of the fridge or mini bar . We paid the Â£20 deposit and then found that we had neither of these facilities in our room! The room itself was extremely small and even had an adjoining door to the next bedroom. This was of course locked but it was rather unexepected. We had requested a "quiet room" but were situated next to the lift and the noise from the adjoining room late at night and in the early hours was also unexpected. Whilst the breakfast was adequate, it was not what we would expect to receive from a 4* establishment - the first morning it was cold infact. Upon being seated another uninterested, clearly bored younger member of staff placed a pot of tea on our table - without asking if we would prefer coffee. We didn't get any toast offered and had to request toast twice before it finally appeared 15 minutes later. Our request for coffee was also treated in a similar way and we then had to go and find a cup ourselves! We were fortunate to have arrived early for breakfast, as other hotel guests were queuing for some time before they could eat. There are insufficient tables when the hotel is full, for everyone to eat at the same time. Efforts have evidently been made to modernise the hotel and we cannot fault the cleanliness of it. However, there was a large crack in the toilet bowl in our room itself which could have done with replacing and the tiling/grouting needed some attention. The position of the hotel is excellent for walking to Knightsbridge and is situated in quite a nice area generally in London. However, we would not recommend it as anything other than a very basic base for a night or two.

Reviews.Title: “A good choice at this price - a pleasant stay”
Reviews.Author: misterniz
Reviews.Content: We liked this hotel - the helpful staff, the good location, the cleanliness and general standard of care and maintenance. We enjoyed the bar, and were pleasantly surprised by the good standard of breakfast. For this money, in this bit of this town, this is a sound choice - we'd definitely use it again. I just read the semi-hysterical rant (which will be below this review) about how dreadful the place is, and ok, the first night we stayed the (cheapest) room was a bit small, but we were happy to rebook for a week later in a larger room. And I want to stress that all the staff, without exception, were helpful, efficient, and pleasant. All those little things that make a difference ("Can we leave our bags till 6 ish? No problem sir, etc etc") were delivered effortlessly, including soft boiled eggs at breakfast. There are a lot of seriously scuzzy joints at this budget round Cromwell Road, but this is not one of them. And from cheap little room 210 we enjoyed watching the Mercs with blacked-out windows dropping off their celeb passengers at the back door of the Cromwell Hospital. They should rent that room to the Sun . . . . .

Reviews.Title: “We had to leave the hotel it was that bad - DISGUSTING”
Reviews.Author: sarahwilson33
Reviews.Content: This hotel has been given a 4 star rating, I really would like to see how they were given this rating. I am very well travelled and I would rate this a 1-2 star at the very most < and that is me being generous. Me & My husband booked to stay here for our 5 day city break, what a huge mistake we made, unfortunately for us we had to leave on our 2nd day. The staff at the hotel are very rude, infact extremely rude. The room had stains all over the carpets, toilet was backing up in the bathroom but we couldn't be moved because all the other rooms were fully booked. The reviews are correct! Paper thin walls, I could hear everything being said in the room next to us, We was woken on a night and laid awake having to listen to the next rooms conversations. Breakfast? Is that what they call it? Disgusting. I wouldn't give this to a desperate homeless person , it really is disgusting. Obviously others felt the same, hence why it was cold and looked like it had been sat there for hours. Try seating 30 people in a bedroom, you get the picture, I was practically sat on the strangers lap next to me, be prepared to find yourself sitting within an inch of a stranger. Hash Browns sitting in 2 inch of water? If you want poached or fried egg then dont bother asking the waitress, they have to request it and it took 20 minutes for me to receive a fried egg. You are seated and get given a rack of cold toast, a drink with the similar resembalance to coffee but tasted foul. There was a bread basket there which was like a vending machine, whatever was at the bottom you got, imagine this, croissants, white bread, wholemeal bread & bagels all mixed together in a basket, the croissant I got was flat and after taking a bite I am very lucky to still have my teeth. For anyone who thinks I am kidding? Go try it yourself. Don't waste your money here, you will find better hotels for your money!

Reviews.Title: “convenient for the natural history and science museum”
Reviews.Author: holidayabroad
Reviews.Content: Perfect place to stay...clean,comfortable,nice resteraunt however a little on the small side...sometimes having to wait for a table(staff great)close to the Gloucester road underground,museums(20 min stroll),very nice resteraunts nearby...also McDonalds,Kentucky...etc (if you prefer somthing more reserved).Sainsbury's 5 mins walk.IMAX theatre a must in Science museum.Harrods not too far away.The show 'Wicked' a must see. Don't bother with Florence Nightingale museum(waste of money).

Reviews.Title: “It's Alright for a cheap bed for the night”
Reviews.Author: stephm27
Reviews.Content: Welcomed into the hotel and advised where everything was. Room was small but comfortable and clean. When checking in they took Â£20 off my card as a deposit. Short walk away from Gloucester Road Tube Station. Which was handy. No noise was heard from the main road. Breakfast however seemed un-organised. Table cloths had spillage on them, the table we went to was missing cutlery and had no jam. I asked for a pot of tea and a pot of coffee and the lady only brought over coffee, so i asked again for a tea and it was very very weak! The cooked breakfast wasn't very good, sausages were pink and cold. Orange juice looked brown and the apple juice had been watered down. Checked out with no problems. We only stayed at the hotel for one night but saw approx 5 members of staff, all of whom were foreign. Which i couldn't believe we didn't come across an English person. Overall, hotel was OK, probably wouldn't go there again though, and probably wouldn't recommend the hotel to a friend.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and price!”
Reviews.Author: rjuzzi
Reviews.Content: I had to find a hotel for 1 night before flying home to Vancouver. The hotel was affordable, clean, quiet and had a great location. I will definately consider staying here again!!

Reviews.Title: “Staff extremely friendly & helpful, rooms clean & comfortable location excellent for visiting London's main attractions.”
Reviews.Author: Liban61
Reviews.Content: Just had a weekend break in London with my wife and 2 grown up children. The hotel was clean and comfortable and ameneties were as described on their website. The rooms were well presented as one would expect with good facilities for a short or extended stay (tea/coffee facilites, iron & ironing board, trouser press, TV, hair dryer) and were well insulated from outside traffic noise. All the staff (reception, porter, bar and breakfast restaurant) were extremely friendly, couteous and helpful throughout our visit and were a pleasure to deal with. The hotel is well situated for visiting some of London's main attractions and is less than a 5 minute walk from Earls Court underground tube station. In our short stay (Saturday p.m. to Monday p.m.) we took in a West End show, visited the Tower of London and St Paul's Cathedral and had a long walk along the side of the Thames. We ate out in the evenings at the West End and at a local restaurant near to the hotel. All in all, a great trip made all the more pleasurable by the friendly staff and good standard of hotel accomodation.

Reviews.Title: “I was expecting more from a 4 star hotel”
Reviews.Author: norajay
Reviews.Content: The hotel has a nice location close to Earl's Court. Bus 74 stops right outside and will take you all the way to Marble Arch and other destinations. I was disappointed because nothing about this hotel says 4 stars. Some of the staff was very kind but some were indifferent. You have to pay in advance which is really strange. We had a contemporary room, it was big enough but you cannot open the windows. TV reception was bad and they charge you for WI-FI. I believe that it should be a standard for all hotels to offer free WI-FI and I never book them unless it is so. This time me and my friend were misslead to believe that it was free and when we checked in we were informed that there was a 14 Â£ a day charge. The rooms are nothing special, the biggest problem is that the walls are paper thin and you can hear everything that's going on in the hotel. Forget about sleeping in on weekends, you can hear doors beeing shut, people talking, the neighbour using the hair dryer or blowing his nose. On Saturday night we were out til late, we came back to the hotel at about 5 a.m. and the staff in the lobby actually asked us to show them our room keys to proove that we had no intentions to break in some room. It was extremely annoying. I am aware that I should not expect much from London hotels unless you are willing to accept excessive room rates. However it feels bad to be charged such high rates and be offered modest service. For 90 Â£ a night you can get really fresh and modern accomodation in central Berlin, Barcelona, Madrid etc...

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: JohnMaloney18
Reviews.Content: Great hotel, very well positioned, friendly and attentive. Breakfast was terrific !! very near to tube (Gloucester Road) Staff helpful, and rooms very cosy

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel”
Reviews.Author: Jacqui1945
Reviews.Content: We stayed for one night and so did my brother in law and his wife. We all found the staff extremely helpful and friendly. The rooms were comfortable and clean. The breakfast was good with plenty of choice. We were able to keep our luggage locked away before we booked in and on the day of our departure. The hotel was very convenient for the tube and buses. We would all stay at this hotel again as it was good value for money. I must admit having read previous TripAdvisor comments I was worried that the hotel would not live up toexpectations but we were all very happy with our stay at the hotel and would come again when next visiting London.

Reviews.Title: “Well located but nothing special”
Reviews.Author: Trevordg
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel for one night whilst in London for a business trip. I arrived at the Hotel at 11:00am and i was told that the room was not ready and i could check in at 14:00. This was a problem since I had a meeting at 14:00 and i needed to get ready for it. I complained to the receptionist who told me it was Hotel policy. Whilst i understand that this may be the case, one must also realise that certain needs must be catered for and a degree of flexibility is required. I waited in the reception for a couple of hours and was finally given my room at 13:15. My room was on the sixth floor however the lift was not working so i had to go up the stairs, with my luggage (thankfully a small one) to the sixth floor. The room itself was quite small however the bed itself was very comfortable as was the bathroom. Wi-Fi service is provided but at a cost. The breakfast was not bad although nothing great - especially the tomatoes which were of the canned variety and covered in a tomato sauce!

Reviews.Title: “London September 2010”
Reviews.Author: jamser89
Reviews.Content: Approximately 10 minute walk from tube station but shops and restaurants very close by. Room was quiet small despite the fact that we chose not to stay in a compact room. On the other hand staff were great and polite and breakfast was very good.

Reviews.Title: “Insulted”
Reviews.Author: Gianniotis
Reviews.Content: Although one night was paid from my visa card few days before arrival, at the check in they REQUESTED the full amount for my stay. (4 days) I found this at least annoying. When asked the reception said that this policy has been adopted since some other person gave them false visa details and then left the hotel. I found the excuse ridiculous but I had to pay in advance since I had nowhere else to go at 19:00 in an unknown city. Contemporary rooms are ok in size but windows won't open. The room had a wooden door communicating with the adjacent room. YES WE COULD HEAR EVERYTHING. Breakfast is ok. Beds are very uncomfortable, mattresses must be very old.

Reviews.Title: “False advertising at best, more like robbery”
Reviews.Author: Tjukkebolla
Reviews.Content: Im not sure who this hotel bribed to be give four star status. I have stayed in youth hostels that were far better. The double room was so small that we could not walk around the bed with our luggage there. I could hear the man in the next room snoring and when he turned his television on at 7 in the morning I got a full run down of the days news. We were then woken again at 8 when the cleaner knocked on the door to see if she could clean it. We were not informed that breakfast was included so we missed it. It is false advertising at best, robbery would be more accurate. It was the worst place I have stayed at in the 40 countries I have been to. It would have been fine for a 2 star hotel at a fraction of the price.

Reviews.Title: “Confortable and clean hotel in a good location”
Reviews.Author: gagui_2010
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for a week in mid-September. The room was not very big but we had enough space for our luggage and it was very clean. We had a few problems using the wireless Internet and the staff did not know how to help us but we finally were able to use it. The location is the best part of this hotel, as it is close to two Underground stations and several restaurants and services. The lows are that there was no ventilation at all in the room and the bathroom, and the windows could not open; and that sometimes we could hear the people in rooms over and around us talking or taking showers; but none of this influenced our good night of sleep. Overall it is an hotel with great facilities situated in a very good location for sightseeing around the city and we would return there again.

Reviews.Title: “This is a con!”
Reviews.Author: NorthEuropean
Reviews.Content: This "hotel" pretends to be 4 star - but it is not. There is no restaurant, no room service, the receptionist is always alone, and the rooms are very small, windows cannot open, and the noise from the communicating doors make for a terrible night's sleep. Best avoided! They charge 4 star rates though. Do not stay here. The Premier across the road has larger beds, better rooms, at around half the price.

Reviews.Title: “Very small rooms, shabby with weak...”
Reviews.Author: mancgirl187069
Reviews.Content: Very small rooms, shabby with weak showers. The photos make the hotel look a lot larger than it actually is. Disappointing and not 4 star but handy location - definitely overpriced. Holiday inn forum down the road much better

Reviews.Title: “Charmless but good deal for London”
Reviews.Author: brunellobabe
Reviews.Content: There's nothing quaint or charming about this hotel. But if you don't care about those qualities in your room, this hotel does have a lot of good points. Reasonably priced. Well located about a 5 min walk from 2 different Tube stops. A good breakfast buffet. A very congenial and professional staff. Comfortable bed, a minifridge, and coffee/tea in room. A/C that actually worked. During my stay, not noisy even though our room was right next to the elevator. London is a very expensive city, and as a traveler, I'd rather spend my money on activities, shopping,entertainment, food, etc than on a hotel room that I only use to sleep and shower in.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely Fine - for the price.”
Reviews.Author: SirLesofBurnley
Reviews.Content: Fairly close to both Gloucester Rd and Earls Court Tube stations, which was ideal for getting around London. Within walking distance of The ... Natural History, Science ... and Victoria & Albert Museums. A pleasant, if unassuming hotel. I stayed in a Double Room and for the price paid, I had no complaints whatsoever. Breakfast was OK, bot nothing to write home about.

Reviews.Title: “Great staff, super location, overall pleasant stay!”
Reviews.Author: Jetstorm_Traveller
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the Quality Crown hotel for a week in July. The hotel was conveniently located to both Earls Court station, Gloucester station and a big Sainsbury grocery store only a five minute walk away! It was a very safe neighbourhood, even at night. The room was very clean, it had all the amenities, the shower had perfect pressure for washing long hair! The bed was reasonably confortable, it was a little on the firm side with some springs, which after we got used to them didn't bug us too much. Only complaint we had was that the extra door in our room let some noise in from our neighbours. It wasn't too bad though. The staff at the hotel have been extremely pleasant and professional. The breakfast staff was efficient, effective and very friendly. The roomservice staff dealt with a problem we had very quickly and politely. The bell hop was extremely hard working and conscientious. Overall we had a pretty perfect stay at this hotel and would be more then happy to return to this hotel and use it as a base for our future London adventures.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: stosto
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for a week with my three friends. Overall we thought the hotel was really good, after reading the not so encouraging reviews here on tripadvisor we didnt expect too much. The staff was really,really friendly except one certain receptionist who was rather rude. But if it wasnt for him i would say that the staff was really good and polite. The room was very clean which was really important to us. The room was really small but it wasnt that big of a problem for me and my friend, we managed. The bed also was really small, i would rather call i a single bed but then again it didnt really bother us that much. The AC was really weird in our room but we opened a window so that solved our problem. The breakfast was also good, and the waitresses was supernice. I would definetly stay at this hotel again, and recomend it for others. The location also was excellent! a 2 min walk from earls court station. The whole stay was awesome except this receptionist as i mentioned. He forgot to book a cab for us (even though he told us that he would fix it "ddont worry about it") This caused us to nearly miss our bus (We arrrived like a minute before the bus would departure) And it would have been ok if he would have said he was sorry but he was really rude about it, and we didnt appreciate that at all. Besides that, dont listen to all the negative comments becuase the hotel was really good!

Reviews.Title: “Rooms too small for its high price - It cannot be a 4stars hotel!!”
Reviews.Author: SamFamily140710
Reviews.Content: Total desappointement. The room was very very small, thin walls and no ventillation. Such small room should be offered as single room, not double. The bathroom was clean, the towel used for too many years, may be it's time to get some fresh ones. No variety was offered for the brekfast, however, the waitresses were very friendly and helpful. We have a much better choice in London in similar location and for the same price if not less. This hotel cannot be quoted as a 4 stars hotel, it manager and/or owners need to travel more and really see what 4 stars mean. We will never stay in this hotel again and will not recommand it.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable & Convenient”
Reviews.Author: grj11188
Reviews.Content: Nicely located close to the tube station, restaurants and bars, the room was clean, large and spacious. The hotel staff were efficient and friendly.. Overall it was a good experience with nothing to complain about

Reviews.Title: “Small Rooms but very clean and comfortable”
Reviews.Author: jdelfin
Reviews.Content: Close to the tube station, wonderful locality, very quiet in the evenings and service is on time and the staff are friendly. The food could have more variety especially the breakfast could be tastier.

Reviews.Title: “Don't book the compact double room if you're a couple”
Reviews.Author: shirleypsaila
Reviews.Content: The compact double room at this hotel is way too small even for one person. One side of the bed is attached to the wall so one partner has to sleep face to the wall. You either have to sleep hugged or wake up with cramps everywhere. We had to get organised since we could not even open our suitcases. One had to have a shower whilst the other one had to get ready. There was no way we could be in the same room getting ready at the same time. The only good thing about the hotel was location and breakfast which was included in the price.

Reviews.Title: “Ok hotel for the price, nice area but the rooms arent great”
Reviews.Author: cumbrian_08
Reviews.Content: Stayed in this hotel with work whilst at an awards ceremony. I believe it was only because we got a deal with this hotel + rail tickets. It states it is a 4 star but no way, a 3 star at a push. The reception area and coffee lounge/bar look very nice but the rooms are a different story and are quite out dated. The rooms were small and rather old fashioned. The windows didnt open and the air con didnt work very well, for the room to be so hot in march i dread to think what it would be like in summer. Some of our colleagues room was worse and much smaller, mould around the window and curtains and it smelt very damp and foisty. The bathroom was very clean however and decent toiletries. Didnt hear any noise from outside the hotel but it was noisy with people walking along corridors and in other rooms. Breakfast was ok, hot items were just kept warm in big silver dishes which meant most things were soggy and luke warm. It tasted fine though. Plemty of fruit, yoghurts and pastries. Overall a basic 3 star hotel so if the price was cheap enough i might stay again but no where near the 4 star rating it states it is.

Reviews.Title: “an enjoyable experience”
Reviews.Author: amanda0409
Reviews.Content: We stayed for three nights in February and I have to say that it was a really nice hotel. The staff were friendly, especially one of the barmen that we found ourselves talking to throughout the stay. The room was spacious and clean and had everything that we needed. The bathroom was also lovely, very bright and clean. It was a nice location, not too far from the tube, with a great selection of bars and places to eat which brings me to the only downside of the hotel, being that the restaurant was only open for breakfast. Altogether it was a very enjoyable experience, and we've already booked in for a return in the summer! :)

Reviews.Title: “Scruffy, dirty hotel with rude staff”
Reviews.Author: cosmicgirl_77
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for one night as part of a business trip. The booking was made by my company and paid in full prior to my stay however the receptionist still insisted on my personal credit card details upon arrival (he was rude and had chipped nail varnish). The room was small, very dark and I could hardly see out of the windows as they were that dirty and looked nothing any of the pictures on the website. Avoid this place - I have nothing positive to say about the experience.

Reviews.Title: “Good location but nothing great”
Reviews.Author: Veronika_BH
Reviews.Content: We chose this hotel because it was conveniently located on a transfer underground station and about 10 minutes walk to Hyde Park and maybe 30 to the Buckingham Palace. Besides there is a Sainsbury's store just next door. First, we were surprised that the desk clerk was not really too friendly when we checked in. I was also surprised that there was nobody to help us with the luggage. The rooms are small (as everywhere in London) but are equipped with everything necessary. The carpets and the chair would definitely need some update, itÂ´s having this "old and used" look. The bathroom was clean and fine. The main problem was that the walls are VERY thin and we could clearly hear conversation in the room next door. Clearly and in the middle of the night. Also you can hear everything that is going on in the hallways. We didnÂ´t buy the hotels breakfast as it was quite expensive and there are better options just at the two closest underground station areas.

Reviews.Title: “Stay Away at all Costs”
Reviews.Author: TravellersCork
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed here on a 2 night pre-paid special rate. We booked into our room which, although was laughably small, was clean. Dropped our bags and went out. On returning after 11pm, we discovered the toilet didn't flush properly and that the bed springs made ridges in the mattress pushing into our back when lying down. Also only 1 flat pillow per person on the bed. We called Reception to complain and asked if it is possible to move to another room with a better bed. The night porter informed me that he was busy running the night audit and will call back in 20 minutes as he couldn't help me at this time. 15 minutes later I had to call him again. He said that he did not have a similar double room but could show us a compact double or else a twin. We asked to see both. We ended up seeing 4 different rooms, all of which had equally uncomfortable beds and burnt smelling towels. We wanted to check out immediately and asked for a refund. The night porter said that he could not do that. When we asked to speak to a manager we were told we could speak to him in the morning only. At this time it was already after 12.30 at night. It was clear that he couldn't/wouldn't do anything for us. We ended up taking cushions from the couches in the lobby to make our own bed which was much more comfortable than the mattress on the bed. When speaking to the Front Office Manager the next morning, he couldn't do anything either as it was a pre-paid rate. We asked again to speak to a manager. He managed to get an area manager on the phone and explained our situasion. When we spoke to the manager he said he will do his best to sort a refund out for us but would call us back later that day with an answer. We checked out immediately. We never received a call back at all. We did receive an e-mail the following day from him to say that they never had complaints about tha mattresses but will refund us one night. This took another week and another e-mail to appear on my statement. Will we go again? Never! Will we recommend it to a friend? Never! Was it a 4* hotel? I don't think so.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent customer service, clean rooms, friendly environment!”
Reviews.Author: SRayner48
Reviews.Content: From the moment we arrived the customer service was excellent! Our room was clean, bathroom was nice sized, and hotel staff was extremely nice/welcoming! Adrian, the front desk manager, could not have been more helpful! He was witty, charming and most helpful! This was an excellent choice in hotels! I cannot stress enough what a wonderful hotel this is to complete your stay in London!

Reviews.Title: “Dirty, paper thin walls and noisy taps”
Reviews.Author: Topdog57
Reviews.Content: This was not a clean hotel. Under the bed was very dirty and looked like it hadn't been hoovered for days. The walls were paper thin; you could clearly hear even the most muted the conversation in the next room, and the water taps were extremely noisy when used. Breakfast was disappointing because we weren't told the booking only covered a continental breakfast, and a cooked breakfast was an 'upgrade'. All in all a disappointing experience, and we will not be returning to this establishment. The only redeeming factor was the friendliness of some of the staff, however despite this I cannot recommend this hotel to anybody

Reviews.Title: “Wonderfull.”
Reviews.Author: LAMBCHOPS_10
Reviews.Content: Just right to see the New Year in , in a quite fashion. Easy to get to, room small but all that we required. Breakfast was just right. And the Barman, Joe you were just wonderfull the Michael Jackson performance you gave made our night. Will return.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent”
Reviews.Author: LeedsBecky
Reviews.Content: We thoroughly enjoyed are stay at this hotel. The room was a good size for London & the bed very comfortable. The walls are thin but we were so tired from all the walking that we slept very well.The breakfast was very good. We were down early but within half an hour people were queueing to get in. The staff on reception were very friendly & helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Very Good Hotel , need larger Rooms”
Reviews.Author: Akramdash
Reviews.Content: The Hotel is Very Good, The room I had was tiny but functional. the Continental Breakfast is not good, one needs to get the full hot breakfast. Bathroom was Very clean and all amenities are available. Hotel staff are Nice and very Helpful . I would diffidently stay at this Hotel again , but next time I will have to make sure that I will get a bigger room.

Reviews.Title: “Honeymoon Heaven!”
Reviews.Author: irish_blueeyes2001
Reviews.Content: We had a fabulous time here. Typical English Hotel - ie. small but frankly that is to be expected in London/Europe. When I say small... that's really relative considering that when you are in a fabulous city like London - who wants to spend time in their room! Does it have a bed? Check! Are the Staff welcoming and helpful? Check! Central to the sights? Check! Great nightlife? CHECK! There was a Sainsbury's right down the street and lots of great restaurants within a few minutes walk. The hotel itself is located on 3 major tube lines - fantastic! Only minutes to pretty much anywhere you wanted to go! This place was very reasonably priced, central to everything and only about a 7 min walk to the Tube! The breakfast was delish! Fresh fruit, sausages, fresh bread, cereal, juice... everything was really yummy! There were a few days where we had to wait a few minutes to be seated, but the wait staff were very nice. We loved this places and will stay there next time we are in London!

Reviews.Title: “Hotel didn't honour booking - worst experience ever”
Reviews.Author: GoldilocksCornwall
Reviews.Content: When my husband and I arrived at this hotel to check in on a Friday evening at about 7pm, and handed over our confirmation email from the booking agent for our two-night reservation, we were told by the unhelpful receptionist that there had been a computer error, the hotel was full, and that they would be transferring us to a hotel in Wimbledon. I explained this was unacceptable to us. We had only booked the hotel for its central London location (as I had an appointment in the city in the next morning), and it wasn't exactly what you would call cheap! Wimbledon was hardly the central-London location we had paid for! I asked why no one had phoned us to inform us of the supposed 'computer problem' earlier, and no explanation was forthcoming. Whilst we were stood there trying to get our head around the disaster, others were checking in without a problem! We were extra frustrated as we had just spent an hour trying to find the supposedly 'close' NCP car park in order to park our car nearby. (One of the other main reasons I booked the hotel was because it had been advertised on several websites that it has its own car park - beware! It doesn't anymore! It will refer you to the Mariott's car park across the road, which is really tiny and you'll be lucky to get a space...) To cut a long story short - we had a manager down to address our complaint further... (been travelling for 7 hours at this point, and trying to check in for around an hour too!)and, after a long debate, they magicially came up with a room with us for the Friday night. Funny that, considering the hotel was 'full'. It wasn't great - very small room indeed as others on tripadvsior have warned of, but it just about did us as we were pretty desperate at this point to be given any room!! They still maintained they couldn't put us up on the Saturday night, despite the fact I had booked and paid for this in advance, so we ended up having to cut our trip short and come home early. It completely ruined what was supposed to be a nice weekend break in the city. We were promised a full refund (for both nights) which seemed reasonable. However, a week later and my credit card has still not been refunded. I've already sent three emails chasing it up to both hotel and booking agent, and will now have to waste even more hours taking my complaint further by the looks of it to get my money back. My husband and I have travelled extensively and this is the worst hotel experience we've had.

Reviews.Title: “Only OK”
Reviews.Author: KEGALL
Reviews.Content: This is a no frills 4* hotel. As many have pointed out, the hotel is well located for Gloucester Road tube station& there is a Sainsburys & Waitrose nearby for supplies. A major down for me though is the walls are too thin & a person next door can be clearly heard even when they're not making much noise, talking, using the toilet etc. We got woken at 4am by a couple arriving next door to us & they were just having an ordinary normal volume conversation. Positives, the room comes with an iron which not all 4* hotels do & the staff are good. I will not be staying here agin purely on the basis of being woken up 3 nights on the trot because the walls are too thin!!

Reviews.Title: “The rooms are very small, like a wardrobe”
Reviews.Author: Helen1193
Reviews.Content: The location of this hotel is not bad,10 minutes walk from Gloucester Road underground station,Picadilly line is good to get to the city centre.
