Hotel is clean, but rooms are so small that you can feel claustrophobia, single room maybe 9 square meters including bathroom and looks like a corridor. Bed is comfortable, there is a hairdryer and ironing board, small kettle, but no fridge and you can not find the adapter on reception to charge your mobile phone, you have to buy it. Smoking is not allowed anywhere in the hotel. Continental breakfast is poor,3 kinds of sausages, only one is eatable,1 kind of cheese,cornflakes,milk,yoghurt, juice,tea or coffee,toasts,bread. No vegetables,fresh fruits,cakes, omlet only for english breakfast. On weekend it is possible to wait for a breakfast in the line for 10 minutes, not so much place in the breakfast hall. Staff in the hotel is quite polite,check in and out is quick and smooth, but 11 a.m. is too early for check out.

Reviews.Title: “An impressive little Hotel which deserves to do well.”
Reviews.Author: tsumScotland
Reviews.Content: Not a swanky place but really good value for money. The room I had was clean and quiet even though it was at the front of the hotel. All the staff I encountered were polite and helpfull, my compliments to them and their management. Oh yes the breakfast was very good too......I got 2nd helpings !!!

Reviews.Title: “Great night's sleep in a very clean hotel that's good value for money.”
Reviews.Author: BristleGirl
Reviews.Content: Good location, just 10 mins from Gloucester Road tube. Breakfast was really good. Room was very clean and bed very comfortable. It's a shame I couldn't get the free WiFi in my room though. Would definitely use this hotel again for business or pleasure.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Wenicks
Reviews.Content: London hotels are famous for being insanely expensive for not very much service. The QCH is a great compromise and I have stayed there, mostly for business, for a few years now. It is a fairly modern property with everything you might want in a small modern hotel including an iron in every room. Free Wifi is also provided so thats a big plus for me. Some rooms are pretty tight but, as I was staying there with my wife for 6 nights, I requested a larger version. Room 206 fitted the bill perfectly. The only downside, and we coped fine with this, was the bed was two singles put together. Normally that is OK but one was really hard and the other semi-soft, so you fell down a minor cliff if moving from one to another. Also the staff, by and large, were very friendly and helpful, patrticularly in the breakfast room. Our "deal" included a continental breakfast and I'd stick to that in the future also. As for location, you just can't beat this place. Five minute walk to Earls Court tube station. Number 24 bus at the door to Baker Street Station, and busy Cromwell Road outside full of black cabs. Also a 24 hour sainsbury's supermarket virtually next door in case you need anything. My tips would be to buy an Oyster travel card at the station as soon as you get there which works on trains and buses. When you are leaving you can cash them back in for all moneys remaining. This one act will save you heaps of time and frustration. Local restaraunts include "The Little French restaraunt", on the shortcut walk to the tube, and Bistro Benitos on Earls Court Road. Both very reasonable. The first with a set price GBP 9.95 3 course menu. Recommend the Lamb Wellington (not very French). At Benitos a massive menu at a family run business since 1979, recommend the King Prawns in Filo starter. In short I highly recommend this hotel for a great London base while you explore this fantasic city. For the money you won't find better.

Reviews.Title: “The only problem was the thin walls.”
Reviews.Author: RiikkaP
Reviews.Content: We had a lovely stay at Quality Crown, the location is great, the rooms are clean and everything works. Except the fact that the walls are quite thin, so if you are ready to bring earplugs with you, I can recommend this hotel. -Riikka, Oulu, Finland-

Reviews.Title: “"good all around, staff very helpful, comfortable accomodation"”
Reviews.Author: wrx1202
Reviews.Content: Enjoyed this hotel room, keeping in mind the european standard of room sizes i didn't find it too small. The room was very clean and the hotel staff was pleasant. Stayed in an end room and didn't notice noise except the showers running and doors closing. The lift was a little tight tho :) I especially loved the location as it was close to a tube and Sainsbury's grocery store which was used very often at the end of a long day of sightseeing. I would stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Don't Forget Your Ear Plugs!”
Reviews.Author: Rudy5
Reviews.Content: Having just returned from a five nights stay at the Quality Crown Hotel in Kensington we are looking forward to a good nights sleep! There is virtually no sound proofing between adjoining rooms to the extent that you can hear everything that your neighbours get up to and I mean everything, from snoring to the nocturnal activities of a young couple! All rooms have interconnecting doors whereby even normal tone conversations can be heard. This overshadowed what was an otherwise satisfactory hotel for this price region. Our room, an executive double, was clean, a reasonable size and nicely furnished (any smaller would have been a tight squeeze) It was not possible to open a window however to get some fresh air which would have been nice. On the plus side, the staff were pleasant, the continental breakfast though basic was acceptable, the foyer and bar/ lounge areas were modern, comfortable and nicely decorated. The hotel was an equal distance from both Gloucester Road and Earls Court tube stations, about a ten minute walk. We would have had no hesitation in returning to this hotel or recommending it if it were not for the paper thin walls and no guarantee of a decent nights sleep! And a final tip if you still intend to stay at this hotel, you can purchase ear plugs in Boots beside Gloucester Road tube station.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Location”
Reviews.Author: runway28
Reviews.Content: Updating a report of this hotel I made two years ago, I was pleased to find a vast improvement in the level of service since my last stay. The foyer and reception area was clean and tidy and there was a pleasant, friendly welcome from the receptionist. Check in was smooth and efficient and I was allocated a room at the front of the hotel. The rooms seem to be very well insulated from outside noise, so despite being on a main road there was very little noise from traffic. Rooms are fairly small, but were sufficient and my room had plenty of cupboard and wardrobe space. The room had complimentary tea/coffee making facilities, a trouser press, iron and ironing board. Standard television with a good selection of free channels and internet access in the room. The bathroom was very clean and well stocked with supplies of towels and supplies of shower gel, saps and shampoos. There was air con in the room which kept it at a comfortable temperaure. Breakfast was much improved since my last stay and standards were noticeably higher. The restaurant was well staffed and the waiting staff were all friendly, attentive and efficient. Guests were offfered a continetal breakfast which seemed to offer the usual fare, although an upgrade to full cooked breakfast was on offer for a very modest fee. I would highly recommend upgrading to the full cooked breakfast which was tasty and was very good value for money. The hotel is well placed for Earls Court, Olympia and is also a short walk away from the Museums. It is located in quite a nice leafy part of London and is a short walk from the tube station so is handy for both business and tourists. While the rooms are fairly small, I would have no hesitation staying here again on business or leisure.

Reviews.Title: “nice hotel..”
Reviews.Author: aaga
Reviews.Content: advantages..beautiful and peacful area 10min to undergound(4 stops to piccadily) 5 min bus stop to baker street near to supermarket and resturants clean rooms and bathrooms quite big rooms (for London) disadvantages the poorest breakfast i have ever seen...one kind of cheese, no cake, no muffin,no sweets only cereal,fruits and sausages.. it is served until 930!!!!(monday-friday)so if u r for holidays it is difficult to get up early in order to eat breakfast u have to pay to see tv channels(not only for moovies and satelite..and for bbc.)

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel at reasonable price”
Reviews.Author: Zoezg
Reviews.Content: This hotel is located in somewhat quite part of London. We had two rooms since it was four of us. The rooms are not too small, very clean and beds were very comfortable. The service was great and every morning I requested milk and got fresh milk for my coffee right away. The hotel is 15 minutes walk to Harrods and Knights Bridge. It is not too close to main attractions. Next time, I will probably look for the same hotel but in other parts of London

Reviews.Title: “Excellant Location”
Reviews.Author: foxdobson
Reviews.Content: Had a very enjoyable stay at this hotel. Staff very friendly and service was excellant. 5 Minute walk from the underground so was ideal base to start from. Would definately use this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “The Ideal Hotel to visit London”
Reviews.Author: MartinOslo_UK
Reviews.Content: My Brother and I were on a visit to see Cat Stevens in concert. The Hotel was ideal for location as very Central. I rang before a little concerned about Parking but the friendly receptionist informed me with good recommendations of where to park. The room was very clean, tidy and well equipped. I was able to log on to the Internet so that was a plus!! (and it's included in the price!) Breakfast was great, a full English and lots of choice and pleasant staff that didn't impose. I can highly recommend this Hotel and being a professional Entertainer I have stayed in Hiltons, Sheratons etc,. but this was a very pleasant stay and just the job!!!

Reviews.Title: “A cute small hotel”
Reviews.Author: CAPCR
Reviews.Content: I enjoyed staying at Quality Crown Hotel. Itâ€™s a cute and small hotel, nothing exceptional, but the room was spacious compared to London standards, and very clean and well furnished as well. We stayed in room 302. I donâ€™t know about the other rooms. The only two things I have to complain is that the walls were too thin, so we could hear everything from the other room beside ours. The other bad thing is that it is not very close to an underground station. About 15 minutes walk. There is a great Supermarket very close to the Hotel. I almost forgot to mention that the breakfast was very nice served.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel, Good quality, Ideal location, Friendly staff, Good Value”
Reviews.Author: TWalshIRL
Reviews.Content: Had a lovely stay in this hotel. Room was spacious by london standards and clean, well furnished, Bathroom clean and shower excellent, Staff friendly and a very comfortable lounge/ bar area to relax after a day. Excellent location close to Earls Court and Olympia exhibition centres and underground to central london and Heathrow 5 minutes away.I will definately use the hotel again

Reviews.Title: “Great location, good value. A pleasant surprise!”
Reviews.Author: trvljunkie79
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Quality Crown with a friend while on holiday. I am from North America but am familiar with the different hotel standards in London. Hotel rooms in London in general are much smaller than in North America. Twin beds are standard, not doubles. You can find hotels that have two double beds per room, but you'll pay heavily for it. This hotel's location is excellent. Close to the Piccadilly Line for easy access to Heathrow and plenty of tube and bus links to anywhere in Central London. Plus, the Science and V&A museums are within walking distance. There's even a 24-hr Sainsbury's supermarket down the street. When you are in London, the point is to get out of your hotel room and explore the city. Our only disappointment was that we could not check in early after our morning arrival from Canada. Otherwise, the room was clean, comfortable and in good repair. Even the decor wasn't too bad. Yes, the room was small but the two of us and all of our stuff (and we acquired a lot from our shopping trips!) was perfectly adequate.

Reviews.Title: “Simple Hotel - ok if you're on a budget”
Reviews.Author: krissyb007
Reviews.Content: Check in was relatively quick and simple. I had booked a double room - the beds however certainly weren't double size, luckily it was just myself in the room as I wouldn't have coped with the bed size if my partner was there as well. Rooms are very small and paper thin so you could hear everything going on in conjoining rooms and in the corridors. The TV had the basic 1 - 5 channels and then extra film channels you could pay for. Coffee and tea facilities available. The room and bathroom (also very small) were clean to a sufficient standard, the rooms were modernly furnished however there is nothing overly nice about them. The shower was a massive downfall - it was about half a foot shorter than I was so I was unable to stand under it, I had to have it pointing out and the water pressure wasn't up to usual hotel standard. No bottled water in the room which would have been a nice touch. The cooked breakfast was really unappealing - soaked in grease and not very hot. I had the continental on the second day which was better - a choice of breads / croissants / cereal and fruit. Tea, coffee and toast are brought directly to your table if requested and this was done quickly. I asked for milk for my coffee however, and was rudely prompted to go and get it myself from the breakfast buffet tables - surely this should be brought with it???!!! We went to the bar for a drink one night, the member of staff behind the bar proceeded to go outside to talk on his mobile phone leaving us waiting at the bar for about 5 minutes until someone else finally served us - we were the only ones waiting at the bar. The location of the hotel was good, 5 minutes walk from Earls Court station. Overall it was ok but I wouldn't return by choice and if wanting to stay in Earl's Court again I would use the Marriott on the opposite side of the road.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Place.”
Reviews.Author: rob_s_way
Reviews.Content: First tip for staying in London that we pass along to all our friends is: If youâ€™re going to purchase a London Travel Card (allowing you to use the buses, tubes etc.) only make the purchase for Zone 1. You can purchase a card that will cover the entire city or only certain sections, but as weâ€™ve learned from previous trips, Zone 1 is where ALL the major tourist attractions are located. Donâ€™t make the mistake of buying a more expensive travel card than what you really need. We booked into the Quality Crown Hotel Kensington because of the cost, easy access to the Earlâ€™s Court Tube Station and because we trust/use Choice Hotel chains extensively. [Another word of advice is about Earlâ€™s Court Tube Station itself. It has two entrances/exits and therefore you have to choose wisely which one to use.] We stayed for about a week in August 2003. The hotel is very close to Earlâ€™s Court, Kensington Palace, Hyde Park, The Royal Albert Hall, Prince Albert Memorial, the Victoria and Albert Museum. In the general area of the tube station are a large number of chain restaurants. You shouldnâ€™t have any difficulty in finding an eating establishment that pleases you. We would also strongly recommend Dall â€™Artista Restaurant located at 243 Old Brompton Road. It is a small family owned/operated Italian restaurant. We had stayed in the Earlâ€™s Court area in the past due to the large number of gay establishments in the general area. This facility is air conditioned, which is a great benefit at certain times of the year. We had breakfast included in our booking and were never disappointed in the variety on offer. There was a safe in our room which was large enough to store everything we wanted. The facility was very clean and the staff very helpful/friendly. Since our trip in 2003, weâ€™ve been back. We decided not to stay at this hotel because of its distance from the main attractions of London we wanted to see most. This was a very nice hotel and other then our preference, nothing should stop anyone from booking into this location.

Reviews.Title: “Old”
Reviews.Author: gumptard
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for a business trip for a few days, good and bad points: Good: reception staff, very polite. Furnishing (clean/modern). Bad: Location - one of the poorest areas of London I've seen, size of the rooms - very small, thickness of the walls - you can hear EVERYTHING from the rooms either side of you and from the corridor. Basically the building is very old and so the walls are thin and the architecture reflects the age. That said, the owners have tried to make the best of a bad situation.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant, comfortable, unremarkable, and rather cramped”
Reviews.Author: ldrvwr
Reviews.Content: Checkin efficient room well equipped and quiet. I was only there for one night so my needs didn't go far beyond a clean room and a comfortable bed, both of which were provided. But the room certainly was small. I don't know whether the bed was supposed to be a large single or a small double, but I was grateful to be on my own. They provided one of those folding stands for your suitcase, but I don't know where they expected anyone to erect it. The thoughfully provided ironing board was useful but having set it up, I couldn't get to the bathroom. Breakfast service good and food nice. Location is good, and as long as you don't mind a rather compact room (which of course is not uncommon in Central London unless you pay a fortune), it does the job.

Reviews.Title: “Good Choice”
Reviews.Author: obk1998
Reviews.Content: We've had a pleasant stay for four nights at the Quality Crown Hotel Kensington. The Hotel is an ideal beginning for a city trip as it is located near various subway and bus stations. A 24 hour supermarket is nearby. Our room was clean and spacious, the staff was friendly and helpful. In summary I can say that we've got the expected value for our money and we will recommend the hotel to our friends as well as we would like to stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Safe choice”
Reviews.Author: Bigbluedk
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Quality Crown Hotel Kensington for three nights and have absolutely no complaints. The hotel is nothing exceptional, but I found it very clean and the staff was very helpful (we actually needed help twice and both times staff showed up in our room in less than five minutes and solved the problems). The rooms are rather small, but this is quite normal in London, so I guess there really average size. I would say the Quality Crown Hotel is a safe and somewhat conservative choice, where you will not find many surprises, neither good ones and, more importantly, no bad ones.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel!!! Good Location.”
Reviews.Author: hwelsh22
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a great vacation in London, England. Was a little disappointed on check in that our room was not available. Had requested an early check-in due to overnight flight from Canada. Staff however, did take our luggage to storage and had a room ready within 1/2 hour. Staff was friendly and very helpful. Housekeeper was very sweet and friendly. Coudln't have asked for anything more. Rooms are a little small compared to North American rooms but otherwise very sufficient for a travellers needs. Grocery store, pubs, restaurants, laundrymat, news stand, bus stop and tube stations all within a short walk from the hotel. Great Irish pub located a short distance from the hotel!!! hwelsh Ontario, Canada

Reviews.Title: “" Noisey neighbours!"”
Reviews.Author: JoyNewcastle
Reviews.Content: I stayed here with my daughter for 4 nights. The location was great, even a supermarket virtually next door. The check in staff and bar staff both spoke excellent English and were very helpful. The major problem was the noise from next door!!! There is no sound proofing between rooms and each word, snore and sniffle was very audible. Our matresses were very lumpy with big springs and buttons sticking up, really not 4 star standard. When we mentioned this on checking out we were told that they were slowly replacing old matresses. If you could guarantee that you got a good matress and no next door neighbours then I would stay again but otherwise there must be something better nearby.

Reviews.Title: “unhappy guest”
Reviews.Author: southamptonweekender
Reviews.Content: the room was very very small

Reviews.Title: “Is this the smallest hotel room in the world”
Reviews.Author: JJKCambridge
Reviews.Content: This hotel had the smallest room I've ever stayed in in my whole life! Room 512! Very small double bed pushed up against the wall with room for just one person to walk down the other side of it. Asked if it was possible to upgrade to a larger room but unfortunately the hotel was full. On checking out I was informed that it was all my fault for requesting a small room?! who would ever request to stay in a cupboard? seriously silly... Lots of other hotels in the area so would suggest using one of them - I shant be going back

Reviews.Title: “adequate for very thin people - who don't like to eat!”
Reviews.Author: jrleonardfl
Reviews.Content: I could actually tolerate the very small room, although I'm a big guy. The other reviews are accurate in assessing the nice lobby and excellent bar. The hotel rooms are well maintained so far as cleanliness, quality of sheets and towels. Gosh, the staff could be friendlier! So many hotels are eager to sell postage and to mail your business correspondence or post cards. Not here - you'll be told to walk down the street to the grocery store. I was scolded 2 of the 3 mornings I went downstairs for breakfast. I thought I had reservations for "full buffet" but was firmly reprimanded for helping myself to scrambled eggs instead of just muffins / fruit/ continental fare. Don't bother as the food is just not that good. Location is terrific. You will find great restaurants walking towards Earl's Court. Unbelievable Thai restaurant, a nice breakfast spot with fresh squeezed orange juice just prior to "The LIttle French restaurant" (another goodie) where the road splits in a Y. This hotel is adequate but I think I can research and do a little better next time.

Reviews.Title: “Nice place but not 4 star rooms !!”
Reviews.Author: milligan1959
Reviews.Content: The hotel is ideally situated a short walk from Gloucester Road tube station, thus placing it in a perfect location for access to all the London tourist attractions. The rooms however, even though clean and comfortable are very small, I carry the bruises from trying to negotiate a simple journey around the room without constantly bumping into bulky items of furniture. There are basic tea and coffee making facilities in each room, but no mini bar which I would have expected. There were only 5 TV channels available, others had to be paid for extra, something else I would not normally expect to pay for in a 4 star hotel. The staff were friendly, the breakfast I cannot comment on as the price of over Â£10 per person was somewhat off putting, the 24 hour Sainsbury's just around the corner provided a much cheaper alternative.

Reviews.Title: “Nice staff but tiny rooms and paper-thin walls”
Reviews.Author: Marvelmann
Reviews.Content: I expected the rooms to be small - they were - but still nicely appointed. What I didn't expect, despite the reviews (I find I often seem to have stayed in a different hotel to some of the guests who review on this site!) was that I really could hear everything that was going on in the next door room, due presumably to the connecting door and thin walls. This was not helped by the fact that the people in the next door room were obviously having a farewell party before they left for China the next day. In fairness they did try to quieten down when I knocked on the door at 2 a.m. and asked them nicely to calm down! The room was clean and the bathroom and Dove accessories nice but the shower was lukewarm on its highest setting. The staff were generally nice though, especially the barman who obviously took a shine to my 17 year old daughter. Well located, but I'm not sure I'd stay here again - there are other much better hotels in the area for the price.

Reviews.Title: “Bedrooms the size of cupboards”
Reviews.Author: hlg78
Reviews.Content: This hotel looks great on the website, but take those pictures with a very very large pinch of salt. They bear very little resemblence to what it is actually like! Arrived late at this hotel, reception staff were unhelpful and unfriendly. My room was about the size of a cupboard and even though it was a double, it only had a 3/4 size bed in it, with barely enough room to walk down the side (the other side of the bed was against the wall so you could not have had 2 people staying there). The bathroom was so small you couldn't sit on the toilet without either banging into the toilet roll holder or the bath. The heating did not work and it was freezing cold. I asked for some fresh milk to be brought up to my room which took over an hour. There was no room service (which I found incredible for a so called 4 star hotel) and the reception staff were rude and unhelpful when i tried to have a fax delivered to my room. The rooms are badly sound proofed so I had the noise of the lifts and doors banging all night. Don't get me wrong, the decor is nice, its just that for me comfort and space are more important and this hotel offers neither. Then, on check out, I asked the receptionist to call me a cab, and he refused saying i'd be quicker hailing one on the street (his would take 15 minutes to arrive). Half an hour later I was still standing in the cold and damp trying to hail a cab. All in all a dreadful experience and I would not ever return to this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Very Small Rooms”
Reviews.Author: gillisles
Reviews.Content: Stayed on business for three days. The room was very small and the walls very thin. The bathroom of the room next door was next to my bed and you could hear EVERYTHING! OK West London Location. Disappointed that there was only 5 channels on the TV but happy with 'Dove' range of toiletries.

Reviews.Title: “Very Uncomfortable Stay”
Reviews.Author: kthye
Reviews.Content: Stayed approximately 7 nights and 8 days. Very uncomfortable. Only saw one cockroach the whole time we were there. I had to stand outside the room in the stairwell as it was about 80 in the room. Very hot and uncomfortable. Window was sealed shut, despite the staff's attempt in opening it. Air conditioner was not working either. Yes, the air conditioner was needed in January. Because the window would not open, the AC was needed. That didn't work either. It blew, but had no cooling effect. The room was clean and orderly, despite the one cockroach running around. That was only one time. But it was otherwise clean. Later found dental floss behind the chair and 1/2 a pill someone had left near the coffee pot, but didn't bother me too much. Just left it alone. Room was small, but we expected that. Pillows cheap and uncomfortable. Towels were thin and small. Bed was kinda hard, but otherwise fine. Nightstand was terribly small. Lighting was fine, plenty of lighting. It was quiet also. Never once woke up to sounds outside in the hall or outside. Continental breakfast much to be desired. My wife ate peaches and wheat toast. I had a crossant with thin meat and warm juice. Ice is a difficult commodity to come by. Same things everyday without anything new on table. Location was fine. Earl's Court is not far away. Used a map to get around to the museums, etc. Good location. Overall it was a rough stay. Not very comfortable, but did meet the very minimal needs of international travelers. i.e. a bed, toilet and bath. My wife may have another opinion, but this is mine. Wife has photos, and may submit a review later.

Reviews.Title: “Not great, but OK for Central London.”
Reviews.Author: SerenEnfys
Reviews.Content: I stayed here last week for business purposes. I stayed in a single room, and whist I expected it to be small, there was literally a walkway between the bed and dressing table, and barely any room for my one overnightcase. Having said this, the bed was a small double bed, and very comfy it was too! The bathroom was similarly tiny, and was purely functional- not the place to take a long soak in the bath. The walls are rather thin, and for the early part of the evening when I was preparing to go out for the evening, all I could here was some chap next door talking away, which had fortunately ceased by the time I got back. Should you have a noisy neighbour, this could prove problematic for a peaceful nights sleep. I was staying on a bed and continental breakfast basis, and the selection fro breakfast was good- cold meats, bread rolls and croissants, Muller yoghurts and a variety of good quality cereals. This hotel was fine for my purposes- a night in Central London for an early morning businss meeting), however I'm not sure that I'd be impressed if I had booked this as a 4* hotel for holiday purposes.

Reviews.Title: “great value for money”
Reviews.Author: cailin_donn
Reviews.Content: A great place to stay in London - the hotel is close to two tube stations. The rooms are very clean and comfortable, breakfast is good and the staff was very nice and helpful. I would book the hotel again for my next trip to London.

Reviews.Title: “No car park”
Reviews.Author: McMotel
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel through Hotel Assist and chose it for location and the hotel car park. On check in I was told they do not provide parking this was discontinued about 3 months ago. The recptionist suggested I try the Marriot over the road or the NCP in Warwick Rd. I drove to Warwick rd which although an NCP is only parking for the council depot next door, the Marriot was full so I ended up in the Holiday Inn 2 blocks away, all this took about an hour in rush hour traffic, leaving me thinkin why didnt i just stay in the Holiday Inn? The room was as anticipated very small but of a good standard if a little worn. I had an adjoining door in my room which the guests next door tried to open on their arrival, the door allowed much of the noise to pass through it leaving me feeling a lack of privacy, thankfully they were not noisey and they were foreign so I didnt have to listen to them prattle on. On the privacy front I was caught with my apnts down by the house keepin gwho decide to let themselves into my room at about 7pm to bring me a free newspaper? The bar was good and the barman was very sociable and humourous. I went for dinner in Earls Court Rd which was a five minute stroll, and can recommend the Prince of Teck pub opposite Nandos. Breakfast I was informed was not on my room rate although I had a booking saying I had a continental breakfast, which the receptionist sorted out for me as it was included, full breakfast was Â£10.50 so beware of this. Brekkie was ok but nothing special. I will not be staying here again as parking is a must in this area of London. The Holiday Inn cost me Â£28 for a nights parking basically anything over 12 hrs.

Reviews.Title: “Very disappointing”
Reviews.Author: apusapus
Reviews.Content: A disappointing stay at this hotel.It was very clean, room rather small.Pillows cheap and uncomfortable, had to ask for another as none in wardrobes as there are usually in hotels and no extra blankets, if needed.Towels in bathroom also needed to be desired, so thin and small, fitted where they touched.Continental breakfast much to be desired, hardly any choice and same things everyday without anything new on table such as different fruit (of which there was only prunes, grapefruit and tinned peaches)or choice of bread (which there was none, only soft rolls).Different meats were all stacked on top of eachother on once plate, so the garlicky smell from one went through to the others, so if you didnt like garlic, tough. Tea and coffee were so weak as well. Well, you've got my gist, very disappointing stay. Also, no information in rooms on things to do and see in London.All the museums a 10 minutes walk down the road but you wouldn't know it, just no information in the rooms or reception about London at all.Plenty on otheer places not in London (who would be interested in those if you are in London) and had to travel hundreds of miles .....beyond me.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyable stay but expensive”
Reviews.Author: Suki07
Reviews.Content: Well located hotel with tea & coffee facilities, very clean bathroom and helpful staff. Rooms small but very modern. Stayed for 6 nights in September 2007. Good continental breakfast in pleasant surroundings. Gloucester Road Tube not far away and a Sainsbury store close by. Walking distance to Kensington High Street shops/restaurants as well as Harrods and museums. Expensive but would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Bad reception service”
Reviews.Author: Porsche2
Reviews.Content: I stayed in this hotel and had a very bad experience which relates to the service level in the reception. One evening I had 1 hour spare time and wanted to get an internet code from the reception. They did not respond in 1/2 hour. As the reception did not answer I tried to get hold of housekeeping, room service, bar and restarurant. No one answered at all. When walking down to the reception they said they were to bussy to answer the telephone. What would have happend in case of an emergency situation? I lost the possibility of working and no excuse or compensation was offered.

Reviews.Title: “unplesant experience”
Reviews.Author: Anders2007
Reviews.Content: Booked this hotel through a travel agent, not very cheap, about 180 dollars a night for a single room. I expected a comfortable night in order to prepare for a meeting on the next day. Unfortunately when I arrived I was told I would be sent to another place because they didn't have a room for me. I accepted that. However, I got puzzled because I saw many guests who arrived after me got their rooms without any discussion. Finally I was transported to the Quality Crown Hotel at Hyde Park. I was told both hotels were on the same level. I thought that was ok. Then, I got a room in the basement with a window below the street, with three single beds in a small room, rusty bathroom...

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, but reception staff very rude & unhelpful!!”
Reviews.Author: katie3659
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel through london town.com who were very good, we asked for a room which would accommodate three adults. The agency emailed us and said that they could accommodate us all in one room but one of the beds was a campbed more ideal fro a child aged 12yrs. I immediately stated I did not want this and they made enquiries with the hotel and then emailed and said would we accept two interconnecting rooms at the same price. I accepted this. However the nightmare began when we arrived and checked in. We were given the key to a room which had two adult beds and a sofa/camp bed!!!! It was extremely small, very uncomfortable and for the amount of money we had to pay there was no way we were going to accept it. We then went back to reception and spoke to two receptionists , a male who appeared to be a manager? and female. They were both extremely unhelpful and very rude when we tried to explain what we had booked and was not happy with the room. The male made a sarcastic comment that unless we were 7ft tall the sofa bed was fine!!! Im sure he would be the first to complain if he was made to sleep on it!!! They point blankly refused to help and said the hotel was fully booked and there were no rooms. We then contacted the agency london town. com who were very helpful, and was put through to a manager named Malcolm who worked in one of the other quality hotel.He was extremely helpful and apologetic. We explained everything to him and he said he would sort it straightaway. Within five or ten minutes the female receptionist who initailly we had checked in with contacted us via the phone in the hotel room and said that they could now upgrade us to two rooms at no extra cost, and also have breakfast free of charge for the inconvenience! We couldnt believe it, and asked how come there was now all of a sudden available rooms to which she just mumbled something or other! !!I The attitude completely changed with both of them after they realised who we had been in touch with. They definatly had lied to us and probably thought they could get away with putting us in a room with a campbed and hoped that we wouldnt complain. As for the hotel it is lovely, (but I think very expensive for what it is)smart decor etc, and the rooms we eventually got were well furnished and both had proper beds!!!!!!! The breakfast was also nice and the waitresses were much more friendlier and helpful. Im just glad we had booked via london.com as otherwise if we had booked direct with the hotel we probably would have been stuck in the original room with a campbed!

Reviews.Title: “great hotel”
Reviews.Author: tripsterDonegal
Reviews.Content: great location.rooms were clean and modern.superb bathroom.breakfast was good in a lovely room.bar was quiet but nice for a pint.barman was a Orient supporter who had a good attitude.will be back.

Reviews.Title: “good value and location”
Reviews.Author: mgwilltravel
Reviews.Content: Excellent value (for central london at least) even had morning papers delivered to room unrequested but at no extra charge good room and service.

Reviews.Title: “Solid as Westminster Abbey”
Reviews.Author: AdventurerAnth
Reviews.Content: Found this place through Let's Go Guidebook. Quality, clean hotel convenient to Paddington Station, Bayswater, and Kensington Palace. I took the express directly from Heathrow and almost didn't bother with a cab. The desk clerk was very helpful, and there were enormous number of flyers available in the lobby. Stayed on the first floor of the hotel, which initially worried be about foot traffic, but there was a small noise hall between me and the lobby which muted most noises. The room was compact, but excellently appointed. Great closet space, clean bathroom, obsessively changed linens. The continental breakfast was served next door at the Best Western, standard fare (even had some ham and cheese for some protein). If you're looking for a full English breakfast I recommend the Art Cafe around the corner.

Reviews.Title: “Above Average hotel”
Reviews.Author: angten
Reviews.Content: We stayed four nights recently and have stayed there before. It is very well located in south Kensington. If one upgrades to a superior room, the room is quite comfortable by American (i.e. US) standards. The rooms are well furnished and quite clean. The hotel staff is very responsive, and the morning breakfast is quite adequate. All in all, this is a very well run hotel which is very good, as the British say, value for money (in light of the pathetically weak US dollar).

Reviews.Title: “Good location to tube system”
Reviews.Author: craftwoodman
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel from June 18 - 23. The hotel is located close to two underground stations in Kensington. We booked this room in what we understood to be a four star hotel. In my opinion the rating should be a three. The room was adequate for our stay, but some of the staff were not very helpful. The bell hop was very helpful and polite our entire stay, and so was the the one gentleman we saw at the reception desk. The rest of the staff treated us as if they were doing us a favor to answer our questions. A continental breakfast was included in the price of our room, which was very high, but if you want a full English breakfast you have to pay more. You also had to pay extra for an internet connection. Kensington, in my opinion, is the best part of London to stay in. We will return to this part of the city again, but will seek a different place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “by no means a four star hotel”
Reviews.Author: gudinuf
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel as a surprise to the other half and I have to say I was bitterly disappointed. The hotel is a three star at best, the room (which I paid extra for and was considered an upgrade) was nicely decorated but very cramped. The lobby, bar etc. are nothing special and again both are very small and cramped. I really wouldn't recommend this hotel if you are looking to stay somewhere nice that stands out.

Reviews.Title: “know room to swing a cat”
Reviews.Author: DJMMersyside
Reviews.Content: rooms ending 01 eg 401 501 are clearly one room turned into two , possibly the smallest room i,ve stayed in after years of world wide travel, .Next doors bath and shower seems to be inches away from your head bored awoken every morning at 6am by some cheerful traveler singing elton john songs in the shower.CLASS. When we complained the eastern european receptionist claimed SHE DID NOT UNDERSTAND

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable”
Reviews.Author: mdgorick
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the Quality Crown March 15-20th while touring London. This hotel is not in "tourist" London, but is conveniently close to the Gloucester Rd. tube station. We were not able to check in until 2pm, so we walked around London- right down the street is a fantastic shopping area & the Museum of Natural History. We came back to the hotel and had a beer or two at the Cafe in the lobby. The staff (other then the head manager) is largely Eastern European, but that didn't bother us. We actually had a chance to speak to the bar tender awhile about his background & it was interesting. Some of the staff are not fully proficient in English, but if you are patient & speak slowly they will take care of you. Our room was located on the 4th floor facing the street. It was large by European standards. It was one of the rooms that had been renovated. We had about 2 feet around each side of our bed, a large closet, a safe, and a bathroom. The bathroom was clean and well-kept. (and had some extra soap and etc...) The only downside to the room is that you can hear everything next door & in the hallway. So if you are saying something you don't want everyone to hear, then speak softly! Our room was serviced everyday and we had no complaints. Our goods got stuck in the safe so we had to call and get someone to help us out. A young lady arrived right away and helped us out, so it wasn't a problem. I do, however, maintain that the safe was dysfunctional. Breakfast was very good. Somedays we had the regular continental, and other days we had the full-english breakfast. (you have to pay for the full-english breakfast) We found the food fresh...and especially enjoyed the cheeses that were set out. Unfortunately, somedays it became very crowded in the hotel during this time of day! My advice is arrive as early as you can for breakfast so you don't end up being squashed among others while eating! We didn't have any problems with the elevator ("lift" as they call it) while we were there. Everyone was pretty helpful when we needed directions & etc.. around London. The best part about the hotel is that it is located near many restaurants (Thai, Italian, etc...). We ate somewhere new everyday. It's also conveniently close to an internet cafe in case you need to write emails home or anything. Overall, it was a good experience. If you are looking for something ornate or posh then I would suggest you stay somewhere else. If you are looking for regular accomodations and a nice breakfast in the morning then this hotel is for you.

Reviews.Title: “Terrible customer service”
Reviews.Author: SeattleliteinEurope
Reviews.Content: I got sent here from their sister hotel-Quality Crown Paddington after they gave away my room reservation (but that's another story). The morning after that debacle, (this was for a business trip) I requested a cab from the front desk at 6:15 a.m. They called my room and woke me up at 5 a.m. saying my "taxi was here". Clearly the guy at the front desk had wriiten down the wrong time as I am 100% certain I told him 6:15 NOT 5:15. In any case- these mistakes happen. However, when I got downstairs for the "early" cab after rushing to get ready- the guy at the front desk began to argue with me and say it was my fault - he was very unpleasant and completely unapologetic. This was clearly an error of the guy at the front desk- but his behavior was worse than the error itself! Horrible customer service- I won't go back.

Reviews.Title: “Hot and 'can I be 'bothered”
Reviews.Author: treehug
Reviews.Content: The hotel is an easy walk from Gloucester Rd station and although it looks like a '70's hell hole the reception and bar are modern, though the lifts and corridors have that dated hotel feel to them . If you are prepared to tolerate the nonchalant reception staff and the downright ignorant porters then front of house isn't a problem! You can't check in early but you can leave your bags before and after your stay and you do get a free paper and chocolates so it is pros and cons. The rooms all seem to be small - ours was adequate but there was no available space around the bed. The bed was small for a double and really uncomfortable, too hard and only two pilows . Sound proofing was fine though even though our room was on the front! The bathroom again was small but spotless and I had a great hot bath - the shower was powerful too. The main complaint was the heat in the room, we were boiling as you can't open the windows, so we had to leave the AC on all night - not environmentally friendly or that healthy. For Â£85 it wasn't as bad as we were expecting but not that great either. The location is brilliant so maybe another hotel on that road could offer a better deal and more chirpy staff?

Reviews.Title: “Quality Crown was great!”
Reviews.Author: Violette_82
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here back in the middle of February for 9 nights. We were both a little nervous as to what kind of hotel we were going to be staying because of some of the reviews on here. We kind of had a feeling that the bad reviews were just from winey people who like to complain and have things absolutely perfect. Anyway, we both loved the hotel. Sure, the rooms are smaller than hotels in America, but I would not say they were too small. There was enough room for our 2 big suitcases and for us to walk around. Check in and check out both went smoothly and quickly. As for the continental breakfast, we only made it up once. It was fine. It was free. If you donâ€™t like it then go somewhere else instead of complaining that it wasnâ€™t up to your standards. The location is very nice. It is situated in between Earlâ€™s Court tube station and Gloucester rd tube station. We tended to use Gloucester Rd more often. Sainsburyâ€™s grocery store is nearly next to the hotel, very convenient. There is a good amount of restaurants and pubs within walking distance. We did not have a problem with the service we received. I do believe the reviewers who said they had something tacked onto their bill, but I am glad this did not happen to us. We did not have a problem with sound. The room next to us was adjoining, but we brought a fan with us because we like to sleep with one and ran it pretty much the whenever we were in the room and if I wouldnâ€™t have seen the people from the room next to us I would have thought it was vacant. The beds were also comfortable and we slept well. Some people here say that no one is ever in the bar/lounge. There was always a couple people in the bar area at all times in the afternoon/evening. There is Boddingtonâ€™s and Stella Artois on tap which was enough for us. For a hotel bar the prices were not too bad. Bottom line the hotel was nice, clean, the beds were comfortable we had no troubles with staff and we will probably stay here again next time we are in London. Oh yeah and if you have to make a local call it is much cheaper at a pay phone on the street.

Reviews.Title: “Poor customer service”
Reviews.Author: Peter28
Reviews.Content: I have been here before with my wife before the renovation. My experiences were OK then, so I booked this hotel (single room) for 4 nights for a business occasion. As prior reviewers indicate, the hotel has a good location (Kensington near underground station Gloucester road) and the renovation ensured that the room (despite small) was well maintained and clean. However, there were some definite downsides to this hotel. An odd feature of this hotel is that every room besides a door to the hallway also has a room to the neighbouring room. The door is closed (so you do not have to be afraid for unwanted visits) but is not very well isolated with respect to noise. So if a couple in the neigbouring room is talking with each other, or one of them is coughing, it sounds like they are doing this in your own room. Basically, noise is a problem in this hotel (not only for me, but also for a collegae who accompenied me during this trip). The next issue is breakfast. My secretary ordered this hotel through internet and also ordered breakfast. Breakfast is divided in a small section that they label to be continental breakfast (limited number of bread, one kind of cheese, one kind of ham, some jam, all very basic) and english breakfast (eggs, sausages, etc.). Beware of the fact that when you order breakfast, it could be - as in my case - that you have only subscribed to the continental version and not the english version. So basically you have to pay about 5 pounds extra for each breakfast to be able to also enjoy the english breakfast (which you might really need considering the very basic choice available at the continental breakfast). But my main concern is the poor (!!!!!) customer service from the (mainly east-european) staff. Some examples: At the first morning we enjoyed both the continental and english breakfast until some waiter came to our table and made us very clear that we were not entitled to the english breakfast and therefore we had to pay. It was not so much the content of the message, but the schoolteacher kind of way this was announced to us. Another example, most items at breakfast are out-of-stock at a certain moment and questions whether they had some jam, cheese or brown bread were not adequately answered (basically, they looked at you, murmled something that they would check without ever returning) or when the breakfast room was full, they just said that you should try it again later. But the most striking example was when we checked out: they added a bottle of champagne to our bill. As we replied that we did not order any champagne, their reply was: you did and they showed a form with my room number with a signature that was not mine. I tried to convince them that there was an error made but he looked not even remotely interested and replied that he was not interested in arguing with me and I had to pay. It speaks for itself that I refused, but the whole way the communication took place in this hotel is a major turn-off!!!!

Reviews.Title: “A good hotel to stay when visiting London”
Reviews.Author: Henryc
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel for 6 nights, the hotel is located in Kensington area, there are many other hotels along this street, so it's good location for visitors. It's about 5 minutes walk to the Gloucester road subway station along the busy Cromwell Road. The supermarket Sainsbury's is 2 minutes walk from the hotel. The hotel room is relatively small (just like most of other hotel rooms in Europe), but it's clean and well organized. Staffs are friendly and helpful. If arriving before check in time, they will store the luggage.

Reviews.Title: “ok budget hotel”
Reviews.Author: Trip-1112
Reviews.Content: Stayed there for 1 night. The hotel is located between Gloucester Road and Earls Court stations. ThereÂ´s also a bus stop about 2 minutes walk away to get to Harrods or Marble Arch if you fancy that sort of thing. Just about the same distance is a big Sainsburys supermarket, perfect if you happen to forget to pack your toothbrush like I did. The hotel itself is a typical budget hotel. The room was tiny but clean and included everything necessary but nothing more. The great thing is their internet-via-TV service for only 3 pounds per 24hours. ThatÂ´s cheap for a London hotel. There was an air conditioning unit with heat pump but it didnÂ´t help against a cold breeze blowing at bed-level. Luckily they gave ma an extra blanket. The continental breakfast was adequate: croiisants, cereals, ham, cheese and toast. Upgrade to Full English buffet for those with big appetite was appr. 4 pounds. The main thing which annoyed me was that I specifically booked a smoking room and it was a non-smoking hotel! Overall I would recommend this hotel for a budget single traveller for a very short stay.

Reviews.Title: “Keep an open mind”
Reviews.Author: Gerttravel
Reviews.Content: I, too, was concerned about the negative reviews about the hotel - was expecting to get there to be turned out on the street to find alternative accommodation. Thank goodness this wasn' t the case. We booked in, the lift worked and was surprised that the room wasn't a matchbox - maybe we had one of the slightly bigger rooms, but it was fine and let's face it, if you're spending the weekend in London all you need a hotel room for is to sleep in - unless you're on honeymoon of course! Excellent base for exploring London and not far from V & A, National History Museum and half a mile from the tube (Gloucester Road). Breakfast was good - we had full English and waitresses were very efficient. Had a pizza in the bar lounge on our last evening and I enjoyed that too. All in all, we had a good experience.

Reviews.Title: “Nice stay but be prepared!!”
Reviews.Author: xXxcharlottexXx
Reviews.Content: Having read negative reviews on this hotel we did know what to expect. Once we arrived we were greeted by the staff who wernt over friendly but friendly enough. Once allocated our room we went to the lft to expect it not to work as many of the reviews had said we had no problem with it. But dont expect to get a lot in there is very small!! Our room was on the top floor but had an ok view of a street. We found the room clean jus the hairdryer didnt work so be prepared. The walls are very thin as well so expect to hear everything

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Hotel”
Reviews.Author: EJayxxx
Reviews.Content: We were a little concerened after reading some negative reviews of this hotel. It is a few minutes walk from Glouster Road Tube station, the Natural History museum and if your up for a walk, Harrods! The room was spotless and a fair size although not massive. The beds were turned down at night and a choccie left on the pillow, which surprised us. Breakfast was lovely although a little limited if you had continental, the full english, however was beautiful. Would recommend to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Decent stay”
Reviews.Author: boricuajetsetter
Reviews.Content: Location: The location is great. There are two tube stations to choose from and nice shops and restaurants near the hotel. The hotel is situated in a residential area therefore it is quiet at night. Rooms: The rooms are TINY. The room that we booked was a double but the bed was very small. There is barely any space to walk around. The room only works if you are just there to lie down. The bed was pretty comfortable and the room was clean. Service: We asked the front desk to call for a cab since the area was pretty residential but they said they couldn't accomodate us, so I was a little dissapointed. Overall: If you just need a place to lie your head, it is a decent value for your dollar. Don't expect any "extras" at this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Booked, but didn't get to stay there!!”
Reviews.Author: helmel49
Reviews.Content: Well, I booked 2 rooms at this hotel, 1 executive king and 1 double last Wednesday hoping to stay on the Thursday. As far as I could see from their website they had rooms available. This hotel was chosen because #1 - it had parking, #2 it was quite close to the Royal Albert Hall where we were going to see Cirque du Soleil. So, we arrive in London thinking all is well. We find the hotel which we thought looked ok even if it was right next door to a hospital. Went inside and the guy at reception said that they had had to let our rooms go as there was a problem with my debit card. Some excuse about there being one digit short. Now, if there was a problem with my card, which I know for a fact wasn't the case I am fairly sure this would have been picked up upon entering the details onto their site. Anyway, the guy said they had tried to call me to let me know. I told him my phone was switched on from 10am and that I didn't have any missed calls and no voice mail message was left. So when we arrive we are non the wiser. He did say they had booked us into their Paddington hotel, If we had wanted to stay in Paddington we would have booked to stay there. He was trying to say it was my fault, but in effect their website is pants, and does not update when they are fully booked! I have since sent 3 emails to the Quality Crown asking for a proper explanation. Have they replied..............well no. So much for customer service!!! In my opinion, if you are looking to stay at this hotel....think again!!

Reviews.Title: “Beware”
Reviews.Author: DansMarin
Reviews.Content: If the hotel is not full, you may get a nice room, but watch out for the "City Room," assigned to those given a discounted rate when all rooms are booked. The room is barely large enough for the standard double bed pushed against the wall. Only one person at a time may move alongside the bed to the bathroom at one end of the room, or the luggage stand at the other. People were helpful - storing luggage for the day, providing train schedules -- but unwilling to give us a different room. The reception area and bar are nice, but smoky, and breakfast costs $20/each.

Reviews.Title: “A pleasant surprise”
Reviews.Author: Barry Wood
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel, despite reading several very negative reviews on this site, because it was in the location I wanted and it presented excellent value. Expecting the worst, I was pleasantly surprised with every aspect of the hotel. The welcome was enthusiastic and friendly, as were the front desk staff throughout my four-day stay. The room was of a reasonable size and beautifully decorated, with suede (or perhaps suede-effect) bedspread and headboard, the usual tea/coffee facilities, and in-room internet for a reasonable 2.99 a day (although local cafes also charge 1.00 an hour). The bathroom was fine, with a very good shower. The bar area looked comfortable and welcoming, although I didn't use it, and the breakfast room was nicely decorated with the Eastern-European staff all attentive and - the word again - pleasant. The continental breakfast was adequate, but one day I upgraded to the full English breakfast for an extra 4.50. That really is superb, with good sausages, thick bacon instead of that thin and brittle American rubbish, and even black pudding. The scrambled eggs were the clincher for me, as they were made with water instead of milk or egg powder. Just a personal preference, but in my experience something hard to find in hotels. If there has to be any negative, it is the tiniest one. Breakfast during the week ends at 9.30, and I saw at least one couple disappointed. Tourists, if not business guests would probably appreciate an extra 30 minutes. And, as others have pointed out, the walls are too thin. I wouldn't hesitate to stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “No Room at the Inn - apparently”
Reviews.Author: TwigsTwix
Reviews.Content: A friend and I, both females, booked a room at this hotel 1 week in advance through Expedia. We arrived at the hotel at 2.30 in the morning to find that our room was not available, apparently due to a problem with hot water. We were therefore being redirected to a hotel in Bayswater. We received this news with some consternation as all of our following days meetings were based on our being in Kensington. Whilst arguing this point and asking to be relocated to a suitable alternative hotel in Kensington another guest arrived. The new guest was then allowed to check-in as normal and was given the key to her room. The hotel receptionist suggested that it was up to us whether we accepted the alternative hotel option or not. He did manage to locate his Marketing Director by telephone who was similarly unhelpful. The Marketing Director offered to pay for our taxi to our next location on the proviso that we would not register further complaints. On being furnished with what proved to be spoof telephone numbers for the Managing Director and the Marketing Director, we were forced to find alternative accommodation. I would suggest visitors to London be very careful when booking this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel horrors!!”
Reviews.Author: Louize
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel directly, as we wanted to ensure a car park space, and if you book through the on line sites it isnt actually guaranteed, as they actually only have 2 spaces which are really small.If you have a large car you have no chance of fitting in the lift which you have to drive into to get down to the car park. That was the first problem. After leaving the car we went off shopping in London, coming back to shower and head off for dinner before going to see George Michael at Earls Court.... the reason we booked this hotel as it is so close. On our return we were then told by the manager our room was taken by the previous occupants , so it was tough but we no longer had a room, and they had booked us into a 3* hotel in Notting Hill, and basically it was just one of those things, and we shouldnt make a fuss... We managed to get them to pay for a taxi, but the other hotel was damp, and nasty. On our return the following day the Manager actually let us off paying for the room and the car park, as they had been so out of order. We felt this was only fair, as they had really inconvenianced us, and another 9 rooms too, which all had the same thing happen to them on the same evening. Be very wary, as this could well happen to you too.Shame, as the bar and reception were lovely.

Reviews.Title: “Absoloutely awful”
Reviews.Author: Becky1016
Reviews.Content: After reading the reviews I was looking forwards to staying at the "Quality" Crown Kensington!! What a mistake that was. We were on the top floor and had to listen to a loud boiler noise the whole time we were in our room. The walls were paper thin and you could hear everything that happened in the room next door. The shower was very weak and there was a condom packet from the previous visitors. DO NOT STAY HERE! 4 STARS IS A JOKE!

Reviews.Title: “Let down by atitude”
Reviews.Author: Bella3
Reviews.Content: Quality Crown Hotel Kensington Hotel is well located clean and generaly in good condition. When booking we were offered the option of a small double or std double room with an extra charge for the std. We took the std but when we got there we were given a small room with two twin beds pushed together and two twin douvet. We went down to reception and found the receptionist to be very unhelpfull and even arigent. The hotel was let down by his atitude.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and that's just about it”
Reviews.Author: pachidermiusz
Reviews.Content: This four star (!) hotel promises a lot yet delivers rather the opposite. "The hotel's 85 elegant rooms have a chic modern feel - their spacious uncluttered interiors will ensure you have a relaxing and comfortable stay", claims the hype. My room (No 403 - avoid at all costs) was small and triangular in shape, cluttered with all not very practical items (like two chests of drawers), with an over-dominant twin bed (the matrasses are very comfortable though), one chair (! - in a double room?!?), no desk (a low round table was to serve as its substitute), no flat screen TV (don't believe the room description), and no fridge or bar! Could you believe it?!? In a supposedly four star establishment? Such discrepancy between the management's wish and the reality are typical for south European holiday destinations. Here I would've expected more decency.

Reviews.Title: “Great accommodation”
Reviews.Author: Duegatti
Reviews.Content: We booked one double room through Gtahotels.com at 75 pounds per night per room, continental breakfast included. At this rate, this was a great accommodation. The hotel is not 4 minutes' walk from Earl's Court tube.Rooms are small but very comfortable and exceptionally clean. Recently refurbished, rooms are very nice and with a warm atmosphere. There is individual climate control, trouser press, in-room safe and electronic door locks. Bed was large and with a good mattress, so we slept very well. Our room (number 103) had a connection door, and we could hear every single word said in the connected room. This was the only drawback. Breakfast was ok ( tea, toasts , jams, cheese, ham, yogurt) as continental. The staff was ok. We spend really a good moment at Quality Crown Kensington. We are surely coming back.

Reviews.Title: “Not what it says”
Reviews.Author: mcgillj
Reviews.Content: Just spent three nights at this hotel with my wife.Booked on the web and I was persuaded by the description of facilities.On checking in we were shown to our "double " room on the fourth floor.In fact the room was so small two people could not pass each other and you had to move a chair in order to reach the window.The bed was narrow and while clean the room was most certainly not a double. Upon enquiry we were advised by a rather unhelpful male receptionist that the room was standard and that "executive" rooms were more expensive.This was in fact misleading because we were able to discover that immediately across the corridor from us were rooms of much larger size at no extra cost.On arriving for breakfast the first morning at 9.20am [9.30 finish] we were told sternly by a waitress in poor English that "You must come earlier tomorrow morning" [Sat breakfasts finish at 10.30am] On check out our bill had mysteriously accumulated the sum of Â£164.50 for "movies" and "music".We had not purchased either and we were told to forget this as it had been a "mistake". This hotel is in a very good location and is quite central.It is just a pity that management could not be somewhat more forthcoming about room details in advertising the hotel.Moreover the hotel could do with investment in staff training as they are well short of the standards of common courtesy which are to be reasonably expected. I would not use this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “An oasis of fresh air during the heatwave!”
Reviews.Author: Pete06
Reviews.Content: I stayed in Country Inn and Suites for 3 nights for my trip to England. I was in London during the heatwave and hopefully I was in this hotel, as air conditionning is actually rare in this megacity, especially for 3 star hotels and Less. The lobby is elegant, there is a nice contemporary bar where people sit to watch footbal games while drinking some english beer. The rooms are quite small, but the bed has an outstanding design and is extremly comfortable. The staff could be frendlier, but they are efficient and they are even able to book some day bus/walking tour that takes you from your hotel lobby to England's deepest countries and charming towns. The complimentary breakfast was good... Finally the location is brillant: kensington is a stylish and quiet neighboorhood that is close to most of London's Attractions. There is a night bus stopping in front of the hotel so you can go out and come back at any time !

Reviews.Title: “Too Much Money For Too Little”
Reviews.Author: aprilwinefan
Reviews.Content: This is now called the "Quality Crown-Kensington", and is nice, except for size of the rooms/bathrooms, and lack of amenities. For the price I expected there to be at least an ice machine and decent a/c, but no such luck. Plus, two people can't pass each other in the same room, barely any space between the end of the bed and the walldesk. Not a bad location, but underground stations (Gloucester and Earl's Court) are located a good walk away. Not so handy after days of constant walking over uneven streets and hundreds of narrow staircases. Breakfast was quite good though, if you have the full english breakfast included in the room price.

Reviews.Title: “2 thumbs up!”
Reviews.Author: princessvixen
Reviews.Content: I chose this hotel on the net as it was a great price and close to everything.having just being around the world and meeting a friend in london(who'd never been there)we wanted something in a good location.Got there early in the morning(8am)and asked when we could check in.An older guy in reception told us to come back at lunchtime.We were able to store our luggage in the meantime which not all hotels do!returned later and got into room(a twin) was very modern with a blue feature wall and comfy king single size beds.only complaint was the room was quite small but then it is london so it didnt worry me a great deal.bathroom was a good size and spotless.had brekki next day(full english which was included in price)-went down well before a great days sightseeing.Next day had dinner in brasserie down stars as went to a musical-food was delicious and quick.staff often called us mini cabs to go to eurostar etc and it was never too much trouble.gloucester rd tube in only a 5 min walk away at worst.cheap internet cafe close by-1.60 for an hour.fantastic italian restaurant close by and sainsbury's next door if u forget something!overall i thought this hotel was excellent value and would definately stay there again!

Reviews.Title: “Just Okay”
Reviews.Author: VeryAnxiousTraveller
Reviews.Content: The room was tiny as would be expected. It was clean and the bed was comfortable. The staff seemed to always be absent. It was a challenge to find anyone working the bar or someone at the desk who wasn't on the phone. It also seemed like every question was answered with "I don't know." We gave up and got better advice on the street. This hotel was very convenient to the tube and there is a large grocery a few hundred yards away. There is a great Indian Brasserie a few doors down. I wasn't unhappy with my stay, but definately would look around.

Reviews.Title: “you get what you pay for, and this is excellent value”
Reviews.Author: kempy&shakey
Reviews.Content: this hotel is spot on. The rooms are small, but lovely, and seemingly newly decorated, and when you're in London how much time do you spend in your room anyway? Anything bigger would just be a waste. Our rate included full-english breakfast, which I don't usually bother with, but the food was really good, not at all greasey. Our rate also included car parking, and I wish they had told me before I pulled my car into the lift just how tight it was going to be... I had about 2 inches clearance either side, and that was with my mirrors folded in... if you've got a big car you would definately have to leave on the street. I've stayed quite a few places in London, and this is where I will be staying next time, but I'll be getting the train! Overall, a nice comfortable stay, and great value.

Reviews.Title: “excellent location,super service, spotless,”
Reviews.Author: kings4444
Reviews.Content: Great Hotel with very friendly service. Comfortable, spotless, small but adequate bedrooms with good but card operated airconditioning. Attractive entrance and breakfast room. Managed to get underground parking, which is very limited and the lift is only suitable for a small car! This modernised hotel is alongside the Cromwell Hospital,minutes from the Gloucester Road Tube and regular buses into Knightbridge-suggest daily bus pass for only Â£3.50 (children free). Sainsburys Supermarket next door is very useful. Try to get a room on the 4th or 5th floor which is quiter. The lift is small for big luggage. Excellent reasonable price food at DaMarco Italian Restaurant, 15 Gloucester Road about a 10 minute walk -turn left onto Gloucester Road from Cromwell Road and it's at the top of the road on the right. It was a favourite with Princess Diana who lived locally, and there is a big painting of her with the owner. Try the delicious red wine with lemonade spritzer! We will definitely use this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Clean and Affordable”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the hotel in July for three nights. The air conditioning was a huge blessing in the rather warm London summer. We found the hotel to be very clean and well decorated. Everything looked like it was well taken care of. I would defintely recommend a room without a connecting door. They are slightly smaller but are much quieter. Some friends of ours had a room with an ajoining door and said they could hear their neighbors quite clearly through the thin walls. Be careful when you make your reservations. We thought breakfast was included with our room booked through Expedia but it turned out not to be. No big deal, the Sainsbury (grocery store) is literaly next door and has both Starbucks and an excellent bakery. We ended up using the Earls Court Tube station more often then Gloucester Road. If you turn right on Cromwell instead of left then make a left on Earls Court Road, you'll find it on your right. There are several great and fairly inexpensive restuarants in that area and we felt like it was bit closer than Gloucester. Overall the hotel was in a nice location and you can't beat the price for London accomodations! We'd stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “an abomination, cancelled reservation”
Reviews.Author: Bellestravels
Reviews.Content: I had booked the Country Inn in Kensington for a one night stay after a long cruise specifically to be close to the Picadilly line to get to Heathrow. I spent countless hours reviewing hotels and locations and finally decided the Country Inn would do because it had a/c, an elevator and was within walking distance with heavy luggage of the Gloucester tube. We arrived at the hotel around 11 a.m. and did not expect to be able to check in but wanted to leave the luggage. The man looked up the reservation and said the room was not ready but we could check the bags and come back at 2:00. So we left and went sightseeing and came back around 5:00. The receptionist them informed us there were no more rooms available and they had found us a room at another hotel in Paddington. Needless to say, I freaked out after choosing this hotel for its location. Paddington is about a 20 minute taxi ride from Kensington and also requires multiple train changes to get to Heathrow. the receptionist was such a [-] and totally did not care about us making it to the airport in the morning. While we were standing there arguing with her, another British man checked in and got his room! I could not believe it. I think we were given such poor service because we are Americans. Anyway, after insisting that another hotel would not do and I could not be carrying my luggage all over London, she called a taxi to take us to the Quality Inn in Paddington. In the morning they were supposed to have arranged a cab to take us back to the Gloucester tube station in Kensington which was not done and we had to wait 30 minutes for the cab, meanwhile worrying we would miss our plane. And the staff was so bad they gave us a big f-you and did not call us with the wake up call! Thak God I had brought my alarm clock and set it. There is no alarm clock in the room. So, to say we had an awful experience at the Country Inn would be an understatement. They were too cheap to put us up somewhere in Kensington and expected us to get a cab or take the tube across town with our luggage. This is the first time a reservation was not honored for me and I am still traumatized by the attiude of the staff. Completely unacceptable and I will never stay at a Country Inn in the States or oversees again. Shame on you.

Reviews.Title: “Good Quality, Small Space”
Reviews.Author: Bill_Alisen
Reviews.Content: The room had great accommodations was clean, and the staff was very helpful and polite. The bed was hard and the hair dryer was shoddy. The lobby/bar was very clean, modern, and empty, never saw anyone there who didn't work there. The room was very small and very quiet, too quiet in fact with the thin walls (ask for a room without a door connecting to another room so you donâ€™t hear your neighbor and vice versa.) The view from room 512 was out the back, so there was no street noise, but also no view. The air conditioning was great. Continental breakfast was par, in fact we only went 1 of 3 days. The Sainsbury grocery store down the road was a much better option--we purchased breakfast/lunch and then ate at the Starbucks in the store. Gloucester station was a simple walk with many restaurants, the grocery store (open 24/7 weekdays), cheap internet cafe, convenience stores, and a few hole-in-the-wall tourist traps on the way. I would not recommend the Italian restaurant directly across the side street from the hotel. The service, cleanliness, and food were horrible in their own rite, let alone combined together. The Marriott across the street seemed much nicer, and the Holiday Inns were closer to the tube, might look into those next time. Otherwise, the location was great. Both double-decker bus tour companies run by Gloucester station too, we found that to be worthwhile for our first visit to London. We booked through Otel and paid $455 for 3 nights, saving about 30 pounds/night with other agents/direct. Finally, we didn't realize the tube stops at 0045, so we paid 23 pounds for a taxi from Liverpool Station to the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel at the beginning of June. The rooms are kind of on the small side however the room i was given was very clean, very modern and as other reviews have mentioned, nice clean bathrooms. My room seemed to of been re-done recently, however, i stayed on the 2nd floor and the builders seemed to be working on the 3rd floor. I agree that the walls are like paper, but beds are great, very comfortable and clean, to be honest, i was asleep very quickly so thin walls not too much of a problem. The hotel is situated in a great location, tubes and buses are all with-in 5 mins walk away, breakfast is continental, this is very bland and the 'British' breakfast, eggs, bacon, sausage etc is fantastic but too costly at around 10 pounds, i would walk the 5 mins and go to local cafe's nearby. The hotel is great value with clean rooms, it's modern and the bar is open for guests 24hrs! fantastic. The staff are mostly european, one or two English, but hey, it's London! The female receptionist can be somewhat 'lights on, no ones home' sometimes but once she understood what i wanted, she carried out her duty perfectly, however, don't expect a smile from her all the time. I stayed at this hotel for 4 days and to be honest, most of my evenings was spent in the hotel bar, very relaxing with big screen TV, only problem i had was that the chairs give you a somewhat 'closed in' feeling. Bar could do with better air-conditioning, only had two doors open near bar, although when i stayed, London was not that hot, i can imagine that the bar area could get really stuffy during a hot period.
