Highlight of hotel for me was the 'Intellectual' barman called Joe. Great character, knew London very well and made my stay in London an easier time. I would recommend this, although more suited to 1-2 people per room. I will be staying here again.

Reviews.Title: “Good value”
Reviews.Author: Jillsephine
Reviews.Content: This is a fine hotel value for the money. I am surprised by some of the other reviews, in fact. (Also, the reviewer who says the Internet cafe down the street charges 80 POUNDS is wrong---the correct amount is 80 PENCE, or about a $1.50. I used that cafe with no problem. There is an even cheaper one in Earls Court directly across from the Tube station that only charges 50 pence---or less than a dollar, for 1 hour. Room is very small, but clean. However, the maid will not change bed linens unless you specifically ask. We didn't mind, but some might. (The card that says "don't change my linens to save the environment is therefore kind of a farce). Electric coffeepot and free instant coffee/tea nice. Also nice body wash/shampoo combo in the bathroom that actually does a good job on your hair. We did not have problems with noise or thin walls. Everything was very quiet. Front desk staff were very polite and knowledgable, also helped us book a tour. There are grocery stores in the area and the Earls Court neighborhood is great for cheap eats.

Reviews.Title: “Acceptable”
Reviews.Author: DrMedhat
Reviews.Content: I've stayed in the hotel for 4 nights in April 2006. Location is excellent. It's much nearer to Earl's Court rather than Glouceter Rd Station. From Earl's court just go through Kenney's Rd or Hogarth Rd, you will be in cromwell rd just in front of the hotel. Internet is very expensive, Â£5.5/hour, if you walk to Earls court, you will get Â£1.0/2 hours. Rooms are small but clean . You will not believe that walls have ears except when you try it and heareven the whisper from next room or corridors. Lifts are awful, needs a lot of attension. Most of the staff are helpful though they might not even be aware of the bus lines stopping near the hotel. Full english breakfast costs Â£10.50 if not included in your reservation. It's not worth that amount, nearby hotels e.g. KK George offers a fantastic buffet for the same amount of money that is suitable to call all day buffet. Overall, it's good value for money, I might come there again

Reviews.Title: “Great”
Reviews.Author: Lindabird
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed from March 28 th till April 2nd. The first day the room was very warm, the cooling mechanism was not working. Thankfully it was fixed the next day. The staff were very helpful, a bartender very friendly and great to talk to. We always got good advice from the staff, detailed maps how to get around. The location is beautiful, close to bus and tube. Our room was very clean, the bathtub, deep for great baths. Small refrig in room. iron with board, hairdryer, a desk. Our room was a twin with 2 single beds together. The bed was comfortable, pillow great. During the week the Euro comforter was placed on the bed,LOVE THAT. The breakfast was consistent with the included breakfast consisting of cold cereal,grapefruit sections, canned peaches, prunes. Cheese and ham and salami with rolls. Orange, tomato, and grapefruit juice. You were always offered white or brown toast with a pot of tea or coffee and jams. The grocery stoor is right next door, we went there daily. Used our debit card everywhere and got cash from the grocery store. We loved this hotel and would certainly Return

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel for the Money”
Reviews.Author: PickyWorldTraveler
Reviews.Content: I recently returned for a trip to England where my mom and I stayed in the Country Inn and Suite Kensington for about 4 days. The hotel is basic. Nothing too great but nothing bad. The rooms are nice but be ware England Hotels only offer about 4 channels regardless of what they say. The room was comfortable and the bathroom was nice. The location is great, it is in a nicer part of town and is 1 block from the underground(learn the underground it will make your stay better). The staff was nice and contrary to the other report that I had read the elevator (although small) was working properly when I was there. The breakfast was not very good but there are plenty of cafÃ© to get a small snack around the corner. I would defiantly stay here again and it was worth the money!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location!”
Reviews.Author: luvsf
Reviews.Content: There were two of us couples who stayed at The Country Inn & Suites on Cromwell Rd. (next to the hospital) for 8 nights and LOVED just about everything! A lovely lobby area with fireplace adjoining the bar area & sumptuous complimentary breakfast each morning in a very nice breakfast room; the most helpful staff we have met on our London travels; unheard of HUGE bathrooms with tub/shower combo and wow! BRIGHT WHITE to boot! We liked having a safe in our room for our 'valuables' when we went out each day also. We also had king size beds with excellent pillows! ANOTHER unheard of thing in most of London for middle class tourists! The only negative thing: THE WALLS COULD BE A LITTLE THICKER! We came back early one afternoon and had to listen to the honeymooners in the room next to ours....with their headboard banging our wall. Very embarrassing! The location was great for neighborhood restaurants and the Gloucester tube station just a few blocks! Our rate was $97 USD for the first week of June, booked on the internet. We hope to return to this hotel next year!

Reviews.Title: “Good 3-Star Hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The hotel was good, for a 3-Star. I stayed in the King Deluxe, which was supposed to be a King-Size bed, but it turns out to be 2 twin beds stuck to one another. Enough space for 2 people. I would imagine a normal single or double room would be much smaller, so i wouldn't recommend it, cause the King Deluxe room felt like a normal double room to me. Clean bathroom. Conveniet location, got two tube stations (subways- Earls Court is closer) less than a minute walk from the hotel. There are alot of restaurants and cafes next to the tube stations. Facing the hotel you'll find the Marriot, good place to dine if you're looking for something classy. The breakfast in the hotel is average. Just something quick to have, before starting your day. At the side of Earls Court Station there are 2 or 3 places to have breakfast if you like. Elevator at hotel is small. The receptionists are helpful, but don't expect them to be extra nice with a smile. Ask if your room has a mini-bar if you really need one, cause not all rooms have one.AC/Heater work only if you insert your room key in a special slot next to your room door,but they give you 2 room keys when you check in,so just keep one key inside that slot the whole time. For approx. 65 pounds per night, I think this hotel is very convenient.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointed”
Reviews.Author: Lindaen
Reviews.Content: I have stayed in this area every time I have been to London. I always look for budget accommodation. This was my first stay at the Country Inn & Suites. I have walked past the hotel many times and based on my impression (from the outside), I expected it to be a decent hotel. I was disappointed for several reasons. The staff, although friendly enough when talking to them, acted very unprofessional. The barman and the receptionist were communicating by shouting at each other across the lobby/bar. It didn't help much that the conversation was about the lousy management, angry guests, how guests didn't understand that the staff weren't to blame for all the problems (again, blame the management!), etc. I spent a little bit of time in the bar every night, and this happened several times. On one occasion the receptionist even came over to my table and gave me a speech about all the problems, again blaming the management. I have never experienced anything like this before. Why would Country Inn & Suites even want to put their logo and name on this hotel??! It beats me. Apart from the 'lively' lobby, the elevator wasnâ€™t working (and from what I heard, hadnâ€™t been for quite some time) and I was told to use the staff elevator. My room was clean and OK, but nothing special. Summing up, I guess the hotel was nice enough considering that I didn't pay all that much. At least not for London and this particular area. That being said, I doubt I will stay there again. For the same rate you can get a better room and much better service at other hotels in the area.

Reviews.Title: “Adequate”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for our first trip to London. On the positive side, it has a great location. It was close to the tube and within a block of a grocery store. Our room was adequate: It had all the expected amenities including a trouser press, hair dryer, and coffee/teapot. We had a double and it was very small (as we expected). The walls were paper-thin. We could hear everything in the hall and the room next to us. The standard continental breakfast is awful: cold cereal, non-refrigerated yogurt, dinner rolls and canned fruit. The staff did not replenish the food after it had run out. The lift was working while we were there. The room met our needs but there was nothing special about it.

Reviews.Title: “good location”
Reviews.Author: samlane
Reviews.Content: this is a good location for museums and hyde park and tube connection to theaters.The hotel is clean the food is very basic would not recommend it poor continetal breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “OK room, Unhelpful Staff”
Reviews.Author: ClaudiaB
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel in London because we have had good experiences with other Country Inn and Suites sites. What we found here was an adequate-sized room that was clean and had a bed with a very good mattress. However, the lift never worked during the 3 nights we were there, the front desk staff ranged from "less-than helpful" to almost rude (I overheard one female staff person being quite rude to another guest - I found her quite brusque in all her interactions) and the location is so-so. (The young man who helped us with our luggage - since the lift was out-of-order - was pleasant) We had booked a non-smoking room and were first assigned to a smoking room. They did move us to a non-smoking but when I inquired why the first room had a refrigerator and the second one did not - for the same price - I was told that some rooms did not have refrigerators but they could move one in for an additional cost - this makes no sense! Continental breakfast was included in the price but each morning we had to ask someone to go get more bowls for cereal, more milk, or glasses for juice for the buffet - they were always out of something. The breakfast options were so-so - what appeared to be canned fruit, cold cereal and white or wheat toast.

Reviews.Title: “Small Rooms, Indifferent Staff”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My room was the size of a shoebox. I could hardly find a space to put down my suitcase. The lift was out of order most of the time I was there but I didn't mind it too much. The staff is not very friendly. I didn't expect them to roll out the red carpet when I checked in but a smile would have been nice. However, my request for an early check-in was honored so I was happy to find my room ready when I arrived. On the plus side, the location was convenient for restaurants and some museums. I would have preferred to be closer to the tube. Not the worst hotel in the world but I can't recommended it.

Reviews.Title: “The WORST Hotel. Avoid it!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This is by far the worst hotel we have ever stayed. The lift wasn't working when we were there, and I was told that it had been out of service for several weeks already. You could see frustrating guests walking up and down ths stairs each day. The breakfast was awful. We arrived at 9:35am and could not have our breakfast because they finished at 9:30am!!!! The staffs were so impolite and not helpful at all. I would definitely recommend you NOT to choose this hotel!! This hotel had even charged for temporary luggage storage!!

Reviews.Title: “I wouldn't stay again”
Reviews.Author: TanyaO
Reviews.Content: breakfast was not great(if we didn't get there early the yogurt was finished and they would not put out anymore), clarity of website (stated that breakfast was included and indicated it was a "full English breakfast". When I wrote to confirm our arrangement it took them 10 days to respond, which was the day before we were to arrive, and they indicated that we were to get NO breakfast. I had to argue the point, send them the link to their own website and my booking (form from active hotels) to show them and then they did finally give it to us). Elevator was not working during our 5 day stay. but overall: hotel was clean, efficiently run, and in a good location

Reviews.Title: “Great little hotel... you get what you pay for by London Standards”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed in the Country Inn & Suites on our honeymoon from July 4th to July 7th (day of train bombings). If you are flying into London via Heathrow the Country Inn & Suites will take you 20 to 30 minutes by train to get to the either Earls Court or Gloucester station. Both stations are approximately 3 blocks away from the hotel but in opposite directions. Gloucester station is the stop beyond Earls Court station but it has elevators you can use to get up to street level. We saw elevators at Earls Court but they only seemed accessible from street level... we could never figure out how to get on them when we were getting off the train. Either way plan to walk several blocks to get to the Country Inn and Suites. If you are mobile or your bags have wheels it is not too far. We found the staff at the hotel to be very accommodating. One thing that you need to be aware of before you arrive is that check in is at 11 am. If you arrive on a morning flight you will need to check your bags behind the desk prior to being allowed to check in. We found that this was not a real problem and if anything it forced us to stay up and do some exploring in the surrounding areas. Kensington palace is only a 20 minute walk away as is Albert Hall and other attractions within Hyde Park. Harrods is a 30 minute walk up Cromwell road. There is also a Starbucks (double the price we pay over here) in the large grocery store a block and half to the east of the Country Inn and Suites. This place is definitely worth a stop if you are looking to stock up on munchies (even beer) or that sort of thing. We stayed on the third floor in the room at the end of the hall as you turn right off the elevator. The elevator is quite small and if you have never been on a european elevator before you will be in for a bit of a surprise... we found the elevators elsewhere in Europe to be even smaller. My wife and I were very happy with our room. It looked exactly like the photos we had seen prior to our arrival. The bathroom seemed small at first but looking back it was okay. You will get a kick out of the toilets. The water does not really swirl around when you flush... but there seems to be a great deal of water moving all at once when you decide to empty it. Word of warning, many of the bathtubs in europe are set six inches higher off the ground than you might be used to if you are visiting from North America. I remember almost falling flat on my face on several occasions but if anything this added to the experience. The beds are softer than we expected but they sure sleep well after walking all over London. There are only four or five television channels available (CNN Britain I think was one of them). Our room was always clean and we found that the cleaning staff took great care to make sure they did not try to bother you if you were in your room. One thing we learned during our stay is that not all rooms are the same. Some of the rooms have long hallways between the bathroom and sleeping area. There is a large seating area and a pub in the lobby. We never tried the breakfast but the restaurant look quite nice. I would stay in the Country Inn and Suites again if the opportunity ever presented itself. My wife and I were there the morning of the train bombings and we found that the Country Inn was a very accessible and safe place to stay under the circumstances.

Reviews.Title: “Awsome hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Well there are no complaints for this hotel, here are all the things i liked. Reasonable price coffee machine friendly staff clean room including the bathroom and sheats the size was big enough walking distance from the tube supermarket next door plus you dont spend much time in the room enjoy london its soooo amazing i would definately stay here again

Reviews.Title: “customer service”
Reviews.Author: jaydee41
Reviews.Content: we where there for 8 days and the first thing ive notice is the manager named mike. came from a long trip and a nice smile will be great. this guy is meaningless.no remorse,no nothing, carlton company send ur manager specially mike the day shift man, in one of ur customer service class..alot of people people are complaining about him. the best are carlos from swing shift,joe the bartender, and martina, at least they do smile. the room was ok. txs. to some people. the housekeeping was terible.and the continetal breakfast [----]! over all they dont know how to smile, i work in a hotel business, and i know what it takes to make our guest happy and warm. there are so many hotels in london stay away from this unfriendly hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Nice little hotel”
Reviews.Author: MBarr
Reviews.Content: Location was great but a bit of a hike to the metro station though. Rooms are a good size with private bathrooms. Elevator to room was broken during our stay but they arranged for the service elevator which was a bit smaller but they could not have been more helpful. Plenty of questions to staff at the desk were no problems with plently of recommendations for tours and restaurants. Good little bar also on the ground floor.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly, quiet, clean--recommended”
Reviews.Author: christinagnj
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel online after doing an extensive search for hotels that met our needs (budget, amenities, loaction). The hotel was clean, friendly, safe, and in a nice location. The hotel is on Cromwell Road close to Hyde Park. The closest tube station is Gloucester Road. Our room was smaller than we expected, but was very nice. The bathroom was very small but worked out fine for us. The shower took a minute to come on to full power, but there were no problems with getting hot water. We would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great!”
Reviews.Author: travelerfromtheUSA
Reviews.Content: This hotel was wonderful. Clean, great location, and friendly. Would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Nothing shabby here......”
Reviews.Author: slkmcs
Reviews.Content: Stayed here June1-4 after a 10 day cruise. We were in room 603 and found it wonderful. My mother-in law was in the next room (604) with a friend and we heard nothing through the walls at any time. The room as of good size for the price in London. We did however store our large suitcases with the hotel (Â£ 1 per day per bag). The room was immaculate as was the bathroom. The bed was very comfortable (king size) with 6 pillows; 2 soft, 2 medium and 2 firm. We mixed and matched to our preference. The lobby has a very nice and quite large lounge with a bar and light menu. We did not take breakfast there; it was quite expensive; Â£ 10.50 and there were several restraunts within a 10 min walk offering breakfast at half that price. Although the halls are a bit travel weary, the rooms, at least the 2 we had as well as the lobby/lounge, were clean, modern and comfortable. Would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “We'd Stay There Again”
Reviews.Author: BigAppleCPR
Reviews.Content: Stayed in room 405 a non smoking room. It was a bit cramped but very servicable. The pants press and coffee in the room were a nice touch. The front desk staff were great and very helpful. There were two underground stations nearby. A lot of restaurants nearby as well. The hotel has a nice sitting area and bar. Across the street there is the house that Alfred Hitchcock lived in. We would go back to this hotel in a heartbeat. It was in a nice convienient area with very good staff.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Value!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: After checking out many hotels, I found Country Inn & Suites to be the best value in the budget category; 58 pounds on their own website. Most London hotels in that price range were in undesirable locations or didn't sound very good and just had too many minuses. After checking out all the reviews, I decided this was a good choice. This was my 6th trip to London and I stayed in that area before, so I knew pretty much what to expect. I was very pleasantly surprised to find the hotel as nice as it was. I usually stay in much more expensive hotels and this was just as good and in some cases better. When I checked in, I asked the Front Desk Clerk (very nicely) if I could possibly have a quite room. She replied, just as nicely, "certainly". Well, I think she must have given me the quietest room in the hotel. I didn't hear a sound the whole time I was there. I was between the stairwell and a utility closet, so that helped. The staff was efficient, the room was very small, but I expected this - this is very typical of Europe. I was by myself so it did not matter. The room was like new and very clean. The air conditioning worked perfectly. I was glad of that, because I was there during the heat wave. Great neighborhood too, one of my favorites. I would definitely stay there again, but I would advise if there are two people, make sure you get one of the bigger rooms.

HotelInfo.Name: Mercure London Kensington
HotelInfo.Address: 1a Lexham Gardens | Kensington, London W8 5JJ, England
